6328 -  def _ReadExportInfo(self): 

6329      """Reads the export information from disk. 
6330   
6331      It will override the opcode source node and path with the actual 
6332      information, if these two were not specified before. 
6333   
6334      @return: the export information 
6335   
6336      """ 
6337      assert self.op.mode == constants.INSTANCE_IMPORT 
6338   
6339      src_node = self.op.src_node 
6340      src_path = self.op.src_path 
6341   
6342      if src_node is None: 
6343        locked_nodes = self.acquired_locks[locking.LEVEL_NODE] 
6344        exp_list = self.rpc.call_export_list(locked_nodes) 
6345        found = False 
6346        for node in exp_list: 
6347          if exp_list[node].fail_msg: 
6348            continue 
6349          if src_path in exp_list[node].payload: 
6350            found = True 
6351            self.op.src_node = src_node = node 
6352            self.op.src_path = src_path = utils.PathJoin(constants.EXPORT_DIR, 
6353                                                         src_path) 
6354            break 
6355        if not found: 
6356          raise errors.OpPrereqError("No export found for relative path %s" % 
6357                                      src_path, errors.ECODE_INVAL) 
6358   
6359      _CheckNodeOnline(self, src_node) 
6360      result = self.rpc.call_export_info(src_node, src_path) 
6361      result.Raise("No export or invalid export found in dir %s" % src_path) 
6362   
6363      export_info = objects.SerializableConfigParser.Loads(str(result.payload)) 
6364      if not export_info.has_section(constants.INISECT_EXP): 
6365        raise errors.ProgrammerError("Corrupted export config", 
6366                                     errors.ECODE_ENVIRON) 
6367   
6368      ei_version = export_info.get(constants.INISECT_EXP, "version") 
6369      if (int(ei_version) != constants.EXPORT_VERSION): 
6370        raise errors.OpPrereqError("Wrong export version %s (wanted %d)" % 
6371                                   (ei_version, constants.EXPORT_VERSION), 
6372                                   errors.ECODE_ENVIRON) 
6373      return export_info 

6374   

6375 -  def _ReadExportParams(self, einfo): 

6376      """Use export parameters as defaults. 
6377   
6378      In case the opcode doesn't specify (as in override) some instance 
6379      parameters, then try to use them from the export information, if 
6380      that declares them. 
6381   
6382      """ 
6383      self.op.os_type = einfo.get(constants.INISECT_EXP, "os") 
6384   
6385      if self.op.disk_template is None: 
6386        if einfo.has_option(constants.INISECT_INS, "disk_template"): 
6387          self.op.disk_template = einfo.get(constants.INISECT_INS, 
6388                                            "disk_template") 
6389        else: 
6390          raise errors.OpPrereqError("No disk template specified and the export" 
6391                                     " is missing the disk_template information", 
6392                                     errors.ECODE_INVAL) 
6393   
6394      if not self.op.disks: 
6395        if einfo.has_option(constants.INISECT_INS, "disk_count"): 
6396          disks = [] 
6397          # TODO: import the disk iv_name too 
6398          for idx in range(einfo.getint(constants.INISECT_INS, "disk_count")): 
6399            disk_sz = einfo.getint(constants.INISECT_INS, "disk%d_size" % idx) 
6400            disks.append({"size": disk_sz}) 
6401          self.op.disks = disks 
6402        else: 
6403          raise errors.OpPrereqError("No disk info specified and the export" 
6404                                     " is missing the disk information", 
6405                                     errors.ECODE_INVAL) 
6406   
6407      if (not self.op.nics and 
6408          einfo.has_option(constants.INISECT_INS, "nic_count")): 
6409        nics = [] 
6410        for idx in range(einfo.getint(constants.INISECT_INS, "nic_count")): 
6411          ndict = {} 
6412          for name in list(constants.NICS_PARAMETERS) + ["ip", "mac"]: 
6413            v = einfo.get(constants.INISECT_INS, "nic%d_%s" % (idx, name)) 
6414            ndict[name] = v 
6415          nics.append(ndict) 
6416        self.op.nics = nics 
6417   
6418      if (self.op.hypervisor is None and 
6419          einfo.has_option(constants.INISECT_INS, "hypervisor")): 
6420        self.op.hypervisor = einfo.get(constants.INISECT_INS, "hypervisor") 
6421      if einfo.has_section(constants.INISECT_HYP): 
6422        # use the export parameters but do not override the ones 
6423        # specified by the user 
6424        for name, value in einfo.items(constants.INISECT_HYP): 
6425          if name not in self.op.hvparams: 
6426            self.op.hvparams[name] = value 
6427   
6428      if einfo.has_section(constants.INISECT_BEP): 
6429        # use the parameters, without overriding 
6430        for name, value in einfo.items(constants.INISECT_BEP): 
6431          if name not in self.op.beparams: 
6432            self.op.beparams[name] = value 
6433      else: 
6434        # try to read the parameters old style, from the main section 
6435        for name in constants.BES_PARAMETERS: 
6436          if (name not in self.op.beparams and 
6437              einfo.has_option(constants.INISECT_INS, name)): 
6438            self.op.beparams[name] = einfo.get(constants.INISECT_INS, name) 

6439   

6440 -  def _RevertToDefaults(self, cluster): 

6441      """Revert the instance parameters to the default values. 
6442   
6443      """ 
6444      # hvparams 
6445      hv_defs = cluster.GetHVDefaults(self.op.hypervisor, self.op.os_type) 
6446      for name in self.op.hvparams.keys(): 
6447        if name in hv_defs and hv_defs[name] == self.op.hvparams[name]: 
6448          del self.op.hvparams[name] 
6449      # beparams 
6450      be_defs = cluster.beparams.get(constants.PP_DEFAULT, {}) 
6451      for name in self.op.beparams.keys(): 
6452        if name in be_defs and be_defs[name] == self.op.beparams[name]: 
6453          del self.op.beparams[name] 
6454      # nic params 
6455      nic_defs = cluster.nicparams.get(constants.PP_DEFAULT, {}) 
6456      for nic in self.op.nics: 
6457        for name in constants.NICS_PARAMETERS: 
6458          if name in nic and name in nic_defs and nic[name] == nic_defs[name]: 
6459            del nic[name] 

6460   

6461 -  def CheckPrereq(self): 

6462      """Check prerequisites. 
6463   
6464      """ 
6465      if self.op.mode == constants.INSTANCE_IMPORT: 
6466        export_info = self._ReadExportInfo() 
6467        self._ReadExportParams(export_info) 
6468   
6469      _CheckDiskTemplate(self.op.disk_template) 
6470   
6471      if (not self.cfg.GetVGName() and 
6472          self.op.disk_template not in constants.DTS_NOT_LVM): 
6473        raise errors.OpPrereqError("Cluster does not support lvm-based" 
6474                                   " instances", errors.ECODE_STATE) 
6475   
6476      if self.op.hypervisor is None: 
6477        self.op.hypervisor = self.cfg.GetHypervisorType() 
6478   
6479      cluster = self.cfg.GetClusterInfo() 
6480      enabled_hvs = cluster.enabled_hypervisors 
6481      if self.op.hypervisor not in enabled_hvs: 
6482        raise errors.OpPrereqError("Selected hypervisor (%s) not enabled in the" 
6483                                   " cluster (%s)" % (self.op.hypervisor, 
6484                                    ",".join(enabled_hvs)), 
6485                                   errors.ECODE_STATE) 
6486   
6487      # check hypervisor parameter syntax (locally) 
6488      utils.ForceDictType(self.op.hvparams, constants.HVS_PARAMETER_TYPES) 
6489      filled_hvp = objects.FillDict(cluster.GetHVDefaults(self.op.hypervisor, 
6490                                                          self.op.os_type), 
6491                                    self.op.hvparams) 
6492      hv_type = hypervisor.GetHypervisor(self.op.hypervisor) 
6493      hv_type.CheckParameterSyntax(filled_hvp) 
6494      self.hv_full = filled_hvp 
6495      # check that we don't specify global parameters on an instance 
6496      _CheckGlobalHvParams(self.op.hvparams) 
6497   
6498      # fill and remember the beparams dict 
6499      utils.ForceDictType(self.op.beparams, constants.BES_PARAMETER_TYPES) 
6500      self.be_full = objects.FillDict(cluster.beparams[constants.PP_DEFAULT], 
6501                                      self.op.beparams) 
6502   
6503      # now that hvp/bep are in final format, let's reset to defaults, 
6504      # if told to do so 
6505      if self.op.identify_defaults: 
6506        self._RevertToDefaults(cluster) 
6507   
6508      # NIC buildup 
6509      self.nics = [] 
6510      for idx, nic in enumerate(self.op.nics): 
6511        nic_mode_req = nic.get("mode", None) 
6512        nic_mode = nic_mode_req 
6513        if nic_mode is None: 
6514          nic_mode = cluster.nicparams[constants.PP_DEFAULT][constants.NIC_MODE] 
6515   
6516        # in routed mode, for the first nic, the default ip is 'auto' 
6517        if nic_mode == constants.NIC_MODE_ROUTED and idx == 0: 
6518          default_ip_mode = constants.VALUE_AUTO 
6519        else: 
6520          default_ip_mode = constants.VALUE_NONE 
6521   
6522        # ip validity checks 
6523        ip = nic.get("ip", default_ip_mode) 
6524        if ip is None or ip.lower() == constants.VALUE_NONE: 
6525          nic_ip = None 
6526        elif ip.lower() == constants.VALUE_AUTO: 
6527          if not self.op.name_check: 
6528            raise errors.OpPrereqError("IP address set to auto but name checks" 
6529                                       " have been skipped. Aborting.", 
6530                                       errors.ECODE_INVAL) 
6531          nic_ip = self.hostname1.ip 
6532        else: 
6533          if not utils.IsValidIP(ip): 
6534            raise errors.OpPrereqError("Given IP address '%s' doesn't look" 
6535                                       " like a valid IP" % ip, 
6536                                       errors.ECODE_INVAL) 
6537          nic_ip = ip 
6538   
6539        # TODO: check the ip address for uniqueness 
6540        if nic_mode == constants.NIC_MODE_ROUTED and not nic_ip: 
6541          raise errors.OpPrereqError("Routed nic mode requires an ip address", 
6542                                     errors.ECODE_INVAL) 
6543   
6544        # MAC address verification 
6545        mac = nic.get("mac", constants.VALUE_AUTO) 
6546        if mac not in (constants.VALUE_AUTO, constants.VALUE_GENERATE): 
6547          mac = utils.NormalizeAndValidateMac(mac) 
6548   
6549          try: 
6550            self.cfg.ReserveMAC(mac, self.proc.GetECId()) 
6551          except errors.ReservationError: 
6552            raise errors.OpPrereqError("MAC address %s already in use" 
6553                                       " in cluster" % mac, 
6554                                       errors.ECODE_NOTUNIQUE) 
6555   
6556        # bridge verification 
6557        bridge = nic.get("bridge", None) 
6558        link = nic.get("link", None) 
6559        if bridge and link: 
6560          raise errors.OpPrereqError("Cannot pass 'bridge' and 'link'" 
6561                                     " at the same time", errors.ECODE_INVAL) 
6562        elif bridge and nic_mode == constants.NIC_MODE_ROUTED: 
6563          raise errors.OpPrereqError("Cannot pass 'bridge' on a routed nic", 
6564                                     errors.ECODE_INVAL) 
6565        elif bridge: 
6566          link = bridge 
6567   
6568        nicparams = {} 
6569        if nic_mode_req: 
6570          nicparams[constants.NIC_MODE] = nic_mode_req 
6571        if link: 
6572          nicparams[constants.NIC_LINK] = link 
6573   
6574        check_params = objects.FillDict(cluster.nicparams[constants.PP_DEFAULT], 
6575                                        nicparams) 
6576        objects.NIC.CheckParameterSyntax(check_params) 
6577        self.nics.append(objects.NIC(mac=mac, ip=nic_ip, nicparams=nicparams)) 
6578   
6579      # disk checks/pre-build 
6580      self.disks = [] 
6581      for disk in self.op.disks: 
6582        mode = disk.get("mode", constants.DISK_RDWR) 
6583        if mode not in constants.DISK_ACCESS_SET: 
6584          raise errors.OpPrereqError("Invalid disk access mode '%s'" % 
6585                                     mode, errors.ECODE_INVAL) 
6586        size = disk.get("size", None) 
6587        if size is None: 
6588          raise errors.OpPrereqError("Missing disk size", errors.ECODE_INVAL) 
6589        try: 
6590          size = int(size) 
6591        except (TypeError, ValueError): 
6592          raise errors.OpPrereqError("Invalid disk size '%s'" % size, 
6593                                     errors.ECODE_INVAL) 
6594        new_disk = {"size": size, "mode": mode} 
6595        if "adopt" in disk: 
6596          new_disk["adopt"] = disk["adopt"] 
6597        self.disks.append(new_disk) 
6598   
6599      if self.op.mode == constants.INSTANCE_IMPORT: 
6600   
6601        # Check that the new instance doesn't have less disks than the export 
6602        instance_disks = len(self.disks) 
6603        export_disks = export_info.getint(constants.INISECT_INS, 'disk_count') 
6604        if instance_disks < export_disks: 
6605          raise errors.OpPrereqError("Not enough disks to import." 
6606                                     " (instance: %d, export: %d)" % 
6607                                     (instance_disks, export_disks), 
6608                                     errors.ECODE_INVAL) 
6609   
6610        disk_images = [] 
6611        for idx in range(export_disks): 
6612          option = 'disk%d_dump' % idx 
6613          if export_info.has_option(constants.INISECT_INS, option): 
6614            # FIXME: are the old os-es, disk sizes, etc. useful? 
6615            export_name = export_info.get(constants.INISECT_INS, option) 
6616            image = utils.PathJoin(self.op.src_path, export_name) 
6617            disk_images.append(image) 
6618          else: 
6619            disk_images.append(False) 
6620   
6621        self.src_images = disk_images 
6622   
6623        old_name = export_info.get(constants.INISECT_INS, 'name') 
6624        try: 
6625          exp_nic_count = export_info.getint(constants.INISECT_INS, 'nic_count') 
6626        except (TypeError, ValueError), err: 
6627          raise errors.OpPrereqError("Invalid export file, nic_count is not" 
6628                                     " an integer: %s" % str(err), 
6629                                     errors.ECODE_STATE) 
6630        if self.op.instance_name == old_name: 
6631          for idx, nic in enumerate(self.nics): 
6632            if nic.mac == constants.VALUE_AUTO and exp_nic_count >= idx: 
6633              nic_mac_ini = 'nic%d_mac' % idx 
6634              nic.mac = export_info.get(constants.INISECT_INS, nic_mac_ini) 
6635   
6636      # ENDIF: self.op.mode == constants.INSTANCE_IMPORT 
6637   
6638      # ip ping checks (we use the same ip that was resolved in ExpandNames) 
6639      if self.op.ip_check: 
6640        if utils.TcpPing(self.check_ip, constants.DEFAULT_NODED_PORT): 
6641          raise errors.OpPrereqError("IP %s of instance %s already in use" % 
6642                                     (self.check_ip, self.op.instance_name), 
6643                                     errors.ECODE_NOTUNIQUE) 
6644   
6645      #### mac address generation 
6646      # By generating here the mac address both the allocator and the hooks get 
6647      # the real final mac address rather than the 'auto' or 'generate' value. 
6648      # There is a race condition between the generation and the instance object 
6649      # creation, which means that we know the mac is valid now, but we're not 
6650      # sure it will be when we actually add the instance. If things go bad 
6651      # adding the instance will abort because of a duplicate mac, and the 
6652      # creation job will fail. 
6653      for nic in self.nics: 
6654        if nic.mac in (constants.VALUE_AUTO, constants.VALUE_GENERATE): 
6655          nic.mac = self.cfg.GenerateMAC(self.proc.GetECId()) 
6656   
6657      #### allocator run 
6658   
6659      if self.op.iallocator is not None: 
6660        self._RunAllocator() 
6661   
6662      #### node related checks 
6663   
6664      # check primary node 
6665      self.pnode = pnode = self.cfg.GetNodeInfo(self.op.pnode) 
6666      assert self.pnode is not None, \ 
6667        "Cannot retrieve locked node %s" % self.op.pnode 
6668      if pnode.offline: 
6669        raise errors.OpPrereqError("Cannot use offline primary node '%s'" % 
6670                                   pnode.name, errors.ECODE_STATE) 
6671      if pnode.drained: 
6672        raise errors.OpPrereqError("Cannot use drained primary node '%s'" % 
6673                                   pnode.name, errors.ECODE_STATE) 
6674   
6675      self.secondaries = [] 
6676   
6677      # mirror node verification 
6678      if self.op.disk_template in constants.DTS_NET_MIRROR: 
6679        if self.op.snode == pnode.name: 
6680          raise errors.OpPrereqError("The secondary node cannot be the" 
6681                                     " primary node.", errors.ECODE_INVAL) 
6682        _CheckNodeOnline(self, self.op.snode) 
6683        _CheckNodeNotDrained(self, self.op.snode) 
6684        self.secondaries.append(self.op.snode) 
6685   
6686      nodenames = [pnode.name] + self.secondaries 
6687   
6688      req_size = _ComputeDiskSize(self.op.disk_template, 
6689                                  self.disks) 
6690   
6691      # Check lv size requirements, if not adopting 
6692      if req_size is not None and not self.adopt_disks: 
6693        _CheckNodesFreeDisk(self, nodenames, req_size) 
6694   
6695      if self.adopt_disks: # instead, we must check the adoption data 
6696        all_lvs = set([i["adopt"] for i in self.disks]) 
6697        if len(all_lvs) != len(self.disks): 
6698          raise errors.OpPrereqError("Duplicate volume names given for adoption", 
6699                                     errors.ECODE_INVAL) 
6700        for lv_name in all_lvs: 
6701          try: 
6702            self.cfg.ReserveLV(lv_name, self.proc.GetECId()) 
6703          except errors.ReservationError: 
6704            raise errors.OpPrereqError("LV named %s used by another instance" % 
6705                                       lv_name, errors.ECODE_NOTUNIQUE) 
6706   
6707        node_lvs = self.rpc.call_lv_list([pnode.name], 
6708                                         self.cfg.GetVGName())[pnode.name] 
6709        node_lvs.Raise("Cannot get LV information from node %s" % pnode.name) 
6710        node_lvs = node_lvs.payload 
6711        delta = all_lvs.difference(node_lvs.keys()) 
6712        if delta: 
6713          raise errors.OpPrereqError("Missing logical volume(s): %s" % 
6714                                     utils.CommaJoin(delta), 
6715                                     errors.ECODE_INVAL) 
6716        online_lvs = [lv for lv in all_lvs if node_lvs[lv][2]] 
6717        if online_lvs: 
6718          raise errors.OpPrereqError("Online logical volumes found, cannot" 
6719                                     " adopt: %s" % utils.CommaJoin(online_lvs), 
6720                                     errors.ECODE_STATE) 
6721        # update the size of disk based on what is found 
6722        for dsk in self.disks: 
6723          dsk["size"] = int(float(node_lvs[dsk["adopt"]][0])) 
6724   
6725      _CheckHVParams(self, nodenames, self.op.hypervisor, self.op.hvparams) 
6726   
6727      _CheckNodeHasOS(self, pnode.name, self.op.os_type, self.op.force_variant) 
6728   
6729      _CheckNicsBridgesExist(self, self.nics, self.pnode.name) 
6730   
6731      # memory check on primary node 
6732      if self.op.start: 
6733        _CheckNodeFreeMemory(self, self.pnode.name, 
6734                             "creating instance %s" % self.op.instance_name, 
6735                             self.be_full[constants.BE_MEMORY], 
6736                             self.op.hypervisor) 
6737   
6738      self.dry_run_result = list(nodenames) 

6739   

6740 -  def Exec(self, feedback_fn): 

6741      """Create and add the instance to the cluster. 
6742   
6743      """ 
6744      instance = self.op.instance_name 
6745      pnode_name = self.pnode.name 
6746   
6747      ht_kind = self.op.hypervisor 
6748      if ht_kind in constants.HTS_REQ_PORT: 
6749        network_port = self.cfg.AllocatePort() 
6750      else: 
6751        network_port = None 
6752   
6753      if constants.ENABLE_FILE_STORAGE: 
6754        # this is needed because os.path.join does not accept None arguments 
6755        if self.op.file_storage_dir is None: 
6756          string_file_storage_dir = "" 
6757        else: 
6758          string_file_storage_dir = self.op.file_storage_dir 
6759   
6760        # build the full file storage dir path 
6761        file_storage_dir = utils.PathJoin(self.cfg.GetFileStorageDir(), 
6762                                          string_file_storage_dir, instance) 
6763      else: 
6764        file_storage_dir = "" 
6765   
6766   
6767      disks = _GenerateDiskTemplate(self, 
6768                                    self.op.disk_template, 
6769                                    instance, pnode_name, 
6770                                    self.secondaries, 
6771                                    self.disks, 
6772                                    file_storage_dir, 
6773                                    self.op.file_driver, 
6774                                    0) 
6775   
6776      iobj = objects.Instance(name=instance, os=self.op.os_type, 
6777                              primary_node=pnode_name, 
6778                              nics=self.nics, disks=disks, 
6779                              disk_template=self.op.disk_template, 
6780                              admin_up=False, 
6781                              network_port=network_port, 
6782                              beparams=self.op.beparams, 
6783                              hvparams=self.op.hvparams, 
6784                              hypervisor=self.op.hypervisor, 
6785                              ) 
6786   
6787      if self.adopt_disks: 
6788        # rename LVs to the newly-generated names; we need to construct 
6789        # 'fake' LV disks with the old data, plus the new unique_id 
6790        tmp_disks = [objects.Disk.FromDict(v.ToDict()) for v in disks] 
6791        rename_to = [] 
6792        for t_dsk, a_dsk in zip (tmp_disks, self.disks): 
6793          rename_to.append(t_dsk.logical_id) 
6794          t_dsk.logical_id = (t_dsk.logical_id[0], a_dsk["adopt"]) 
6795          self.cfg.SetDiskID(t_dsk, pnode_name) 
6796        result = self.rpc.call_blockdev_rename(pnode_name, 
6797                                               zip(tmp_disks, rename_to)) 
6798        result.Raise("Failed to rename adoped LVs") 
6799      else: 
6800        feedback_fn("* creating instance disks...") 
6801        try: 
6802          _CreateDisks(self, iobj) 
6803        except errors.OpExecError: 
6804          self.LogWarning("Device creation failed, reverting...") 
6805          try: 
6806            _RemoveDisks(self, iobj) 
6807          finally: 
6808            self.cfg.ReleaseDRBDMinors(instance) 
6809            raise 
6810   
6811      feedback_fn("adding instance %s to cluster config" % instance) 
6812   
6813      self.cfg.AddInstance(iobj, self.proc.GetECId()) 
6814   
6815      # Declare that we don't want to remove the instance lock anymore, as we've 
6816      # added the instance to the config 
6817      del self.remove_locks[locking.LEVEL_INSTANCE] 
6818      # Unlock all the nodes 
6819      if self.op.mode == constants.INSTANCE_IMPORT: 
6820        nodes_keep = [self.op.src_node] 
6821        nodes_release = [node for node in self.acquired_locks[locking.LEVEL_NODE] 
6822                         if node != self.op.src_node] 
6823        self.context.glm.release(locking.LEVEL_NODE, nodes_release) 
6824        self.acquired_locks[locking.LEVEL_NODE] = nodes_keep 
6825      else: 
6826        self.context.glm.release(locking.LEVEL_NODE) 
6827        del self.acquired_locks[locking.LEVEL_NODE] 
6828   
6829      if self.op.wait_for_sync: 
6830        disk_abort = not _WaitForSync(self, iobj) 
6831      elif iobj.disk_template in constants.DTS_NET_MIRROR: 
6832        # make sure the disks are not degraded (still sync-ing is ok) 
6833        time.sleep(15) 
6834        feedback_fn("* checking mirrors status") 
6835        disk_abort = not _WaitForSync(self, iobj, oneshot=True) 
6836      else: 
6837        disk_abort = False 
6838   
6839      if disk_abort: 
6840        _RemoveDisks(self, iobj) 
6841        self.cfg.RemoveInstance(iobj.name) 
6842        # Make sure the instance lock gets removed 
6843        self.remove_locks[locking.LEVEL_INSTANCE] = iobj.name 
6844        raise errors.OpExecError("There are some degraded disks for" 
6845                                 " this instance") 
6846   
6847      if iobj.disk_template != constants.DT_DISKLESS and not self.adopt_disks: 
6848        if self.op.mode == constants.INSTANCE_CREATE: 
6849          if not self.op.no_install: 
6850            feedback_fn("* running the instance OS create scripts...") 
6851            # FIXME: pass debug option from opcode to backend 
6852            result = self.rpc.call_instance_os_add(pnode_name, iobj, False, 
6853                                                   self.op.debug_level) 
6854            result.Raise("Could not add os for instance %s" 
6855                         " on node %s" % (instance, pnode_name)) 
6856   
6857        elif self.op.mode == constants.INSTANCE_IMPORT: 
6858          feedback_fn("* running the instance OS import scripts...") 
6859          src_node = self.op.src_node 
6860          src_images = self.src_images 
6861          cluster_name = self.cfg.GetClusterName() 
6862          # FIXME: pass debug option from opcode to backend 
6863          import_result = self.rpc.call_instance_os_import(pnode_name, iobj, 
6864                                                           src_node, src_images, 
6865                                                           cluster_name, 
6866                                                           self.op.debug_level) 
6867          msg = import_result.fail_msg 
6868          if msg: 
6869            self.LogWarning("Error while importing the disk images for instance" 
6870                            " %s on node %s: %s" % (instance, pnode_name, msg)) 
6871        else: 
6872          # also checked in the prereq part 
6873          raise errors.ProgrammerError("Unknown OS initialization mode '%s'" 
6874                                       % self.op.mode) 
6875   
6876      if self.op.start: 
6877        iobj.admin_up = True 
6878        self.cfg.Update(iobj, feedback_fn) 
6879        logging.info("Starting instance %s on node %s", instance, pnode_name) 
6880        feedback_fn("* starting instance...") 
6881        result = self.rpc.call_instance_start(pnode_name, iobj, None, None) 
6882        result.Raise("Could not start instance") 
6883   
6884      return list(iobj.all_nodes)

6905   
6906      """

6912 -  def Exec(self, feedback_fn):

6914   
6915      """

6917      node = instance.primary_node 
6918

6920                                               [instance.hypervisor])[node] 
6921      node_insts.Raise("Can't get node information from %s" % node) 
6922

6924        raise errors.OpExecError("Instance %s is not running." % instance.name) 
6925

6927

6929      cluster = self.cfg.GetClusterInfo() 
6930      # beparams and hvparams are passed separately, to avoid editing the 
6931      # instance and then saving the defaults in the instance itself. 
6932      hvparams = cluster.FillHV(instance) 
6933      beparams = cluster.FillBE(instance) 
6934      console_cmd = hyper.GetShellCommandForConsole(instance, hvparams, beparams) 
6935   
6936      # build ssh cmdline 
6937      return self.ssh.BuildCmd(node, "root", console_cmd, batch=True, tty=True)

6960 -  def ExpandNames(self):

6966      elif self.op.remote_node is not None: 
6967        remote_node = _ExpandNodeName(self.cfg, self.op.remote_node)

6973        # FindUnusedMinor will conflict

6987 -  def DeclareLocks(self, level): 

6988      # If we're not already locking all nodes in the set we have to declare the 
6989      # instance's primary/secondary nodes. 
6990      if (level == locking.LEVEL_NODE and 
6991          self.needed_locks[locking.LEVEL_NODE] is not locking.ALL_SET):

6994 -  def BuildHooksEnv(self): 

6995      """Build hooks env. 
6996   
6997      This runs on the master, the primary and all the secondaries. 
6998   
6999      """ 
7000      instance = self.replacer.instance 
7001      env = { 
7002        "MODE": self.op.mode, 
7003        "NEW_SECONDARY": self.op.remote_node, 
7004        "OLD_SECONDARY": instance.secondary_nodes[0], 
7005        } 
7006      env.update(_BuildInstanceHookEnvByObject(self, instance)) 
7007      nl = [ 
7008        self.cfg.GetMasterNode(), 
7009        instance.primary_node, 
7010        ] 
7011      if self.op.remote_node is not None: 
7012        nl.append(self.op.remote_node) 
7013      return env, nl, nl

7079 -  def DeclareLocks(self, level): 

7080      # If we're not already locking all nodes in the set we have to declare the 
7081      # instance's primary/secondary nodes. 
7082      if (level == locking.LEVEL_NODE and 
7083          self.needed_locks[locking.LEVEL_NODE] is not locking.ALL_SET): 
7084        self._LockInstancesNodes()

7135    @staticmethod 

7136 -  def CheckArguments(mode, remote_node, iallocator): 

7137      """Helper function for users of this class. 
7138   
7139      """ 
7140      # check for valid parameter combination 
7141      if mode == constants.REPLACE_DISK_CHG: 
7142        if remote_node is None and iallocator is None: 
7143          raise errors.OpPrereqError("When changing the secondary either an" 
7144                                     " iallocator script must be used or the" 
7145                                     " new node given", errors.ECODE_INVAL) 
7146   
7147        if remote_node is not None and iallocator is not None: 
7148          raise errors.OpPrereqError("Give either the iallocator or the new" 
7149                                     " secondary, not both", errors.ECODE_INVAL) 
7150   
7151      elif remote_node is not None or iallocator is not None: 
7152        # Not replacing the secondary 
7153        raise errors.OpPrereqError("The iallocator and new node options can" 
7154                                   " only be used when changing the" 
7155                                   " secondary node", errors.ECODE_INVAL) 

7156   
7157    @staticmethod 

7158 -  def _RunAllocator(lu, iallocator_name, instance_name, relocate_from): 

7159      """Compute a new secondary node using an IAllocator. 
7160   
7161      """ 
7162      ial = IAllocator(lu.cfg, lu.rpc, 
7163                       mode=constants.IALLOCATOR_MODE_RELOC, 
7164                       name=instance_name, 
7165                       relocate_from=relocate_from) 
7166   
7167      ial.Run(iallocator_name) 
7168   
7169      if not ial.success: 
7170        raise errors.OpPrereqError("Can't compute nodes using iallocator '%s':" 
7171                                   " %s" % (iallocator_name, ial.info), 
7172                                   errors.ECODE_NORES) 
7173   
7174      if len(ial.result) != ial.required_nodes: 
7175        raise errors.OpPrereqError("iallocator '%s' returned invalid number" 
7176                                   " of nodes (%s), required %s" % 
7177                                   (iallocator_name, 
7178                                    len(ial.result), ial.required_nodes), 
7179                                   errors.ECODE_FAULT) 
7180   
7181      remote_node_name = ial.result[0] 
7182   
7183      lu.LogInfo("Selected new secondary for instance '%s': %s", 
7184                 instance_name, remote_node_name) 
7185   
7186      return remote_node_name

7188 -  def _FindFaultyDisks(self, node_name): 

7189      return _FindFaultyInstanceDisks(self.cfg, self.rpc, self.instance, 
7190                                      node_name, True)

7192 -  def CheckPrereq(self): 

7193      """Check prerequisites. 
7194   
7195      This checks that the instance is in the cluster. 
7196   
7197      """ 
7198      self.instance = instance = self.cfg.GetInstanceInfo(self.instance_name) 
7199      assert instance is not None, \ 
7200        "Cannot retrieve locked instance %s" % self.instance_name 
7201   
7202      if instance.disk_template != constants.DT_DRBD8: 
7203        raise errors.OpPrereqError("Can only run replace disks for DRBD8-based" 
7204                                   " instances", errors.ECODE_INVAL) 
7205   
7206      if len(instance.secondary_nodes) != 1: 
7207        raise errors.OpPrereqError("The instance has a strange layout," 
7208                                   " expected one secondary but found %d" % 
7209                                   len(instance.secondary_nodes), 
7210                                   errors.ECODE_FAULT) 
7211   
7212      if not self.delay_iallocator:

7215 -  def _CheckPrereq2(self): 

7216      """Check prerequisites, second part. 
7217   
7218      This function should always be part of CheckPrereq. It was separated and is 
7219      now called from Exec because during node evacuation iallocator was only 
7220      called with an unmodified cluster model, not taking planned changes into 
7221      account. 
7222   
7223      """ 
7224      instance = self.instance 
7225      secondary_node = instance.secondary_nodes[0] 
7226   
7227      if self.iallocator_name is None: 
7228        remote_node = self.remote_node 
7229      else: 
7230        remote_node = self._RunAllocator(self.lu, self.iallocator_name, 
7231                                         instance.name, instance.secondary_nodes) 
7232   
7233      if remote_node is not None: 
7234        self.remote_node_info = self.cfg.GetNodeInfo(remote_node) 
7235        assert self.remote_node_info is not None, \ 
7236          "Cannot retrieve locked node %s" % remote_node 
7237      else: 
7238        self.remote_node_info = None 
7239   
7240      if remote_node == self.instance.primary_node: 
7241        raise errors.OpPrereqError("The specified node is the primary node of" 
7242                                   " the instance.", errors.ECODE_INVAL) 
7243   
7244      if remote_node == secondary_node: 
7245        raise errors.OpPrereqError("The specified node is already the" 
7246                                   " secondary node of the instance.", 
7247                                   errors.ECODE_INVAL) 
7248   
7249      if self.disks and self.mode in (constants.REPLACE_DISK_AUTO, 
7250                                      constants.REPLACE_DISK_CHG): 
7251        raise errors.OpPrereqError("Cannot specify disks to be replaced", 
7252                                   errors.ECODE_INVAL) 
7253   
7254      if self.mode == constants.REPLACE_DISK_AUTO: 
7255        faulty_primary = self._FindFaultyDisks(instance.primary_node) 
7256        faulty_secondary = self._FindFaultyDisks(secondary_node) 
7257   
7258        if faulty_primary and faulty_secondary: 
7259          raise errors.OpPrereqError("Instance %s has faulty disks on more than" 
7260                                     " one node and can not be repaired" 
7261                                     " automatically" % self.instance_name, 
7262                                     errors.ECODE_STATE) 
7263   
7264        if faulty_primary: 
7265          self.disks = faulty_primary 
7266          self.target_node = instance.primary_node 
7267          self.other_node = secondary_node 
7268          check_nodes = [self.target_node, self.other_node] 
7269        elif faulty_secondary: 
7270          self.disks = faulty_secondary 
7271          self.target_node = secondary_node 
7272          self.other_node = instance.primary_node 
7273          check_nodes = [self.target_node, self.other_node] 
7274        else: 
7275          self.disks = [] 
7276          check_nodes = [] 
7277   
7278      else: 
7279        # Non-automatic modes 
7280        if self.mode == constants.REPLACE_DISK_PRI: 
7281          self.target_node = instance.primary_node 
7282          self.other_node = secondary_node 
7283          check_nodes = [self.target_node, self.other_node] 
7284   
7285        elif self.mode == constants.REPLACE_DISK_SEC: 
7286          self.target_node = secondary_node 
7287          self.other_node = instance.primary_node 
7288          check_nodes = [self.target_node, self.other_node] 
7289   
7290        elif self.mode == constants.REPLACE_DISK_CHG: 
7291          self.new_node = remote_node 
7292          self.other_node = instance.primary_node 
7293          self.target_node = secondary_node 
7294          check_nodes = [self.new_node, self.other_node] 
7295   
7296          _CheckNodeNotDrained(self.lu, remote_node) 
7297   
7298          old_node_info = self.cfg.GetNodeInfo(secondary_node) 
7299          assert old_node_info is not None 
7300          if old_node_info.offline and not self.early_release: 
7301            # doesn't make sense to delay the release 
7302            self.early_release = True 
7303            self.lu.LogInfo("Old secondary %s is offline, automatically enabling" 
7304                            " early-release mode", secondary_node) 
7305   
7306        else: 
7307          raise errors.ProgrammerError("Unhandled disk replace mode (%s)" % 
7308                                       self.mode) 
7309   
7310        # If not specified all disks should be replaced 
7311        if not self.disks: 
7312          self.disks = range(len(self.instance.disks)) 
7313   
7314      for node in check_nodes: 
7315        _CheckNodeOnline(self.lu, node) 
7316   
7317      # Check whether disks are valid 
7318      for disk_idx in self.disks: 
7319        instance.FindDisk(disk_idx) 
7320   
7321      # Get secondary node IP addresses 
7322      node_2nd_ip = {} 
7323   
7324      for node_name in [self.target_node, self.other_node, self.new_node]: 
7325        if node_name is not None: 
7326          node_2nd_ip[node_name] = self.cfg.GetNodeInfo(node_name).secondary_ip 
7327   
7328      self.node_secondary_ip = node_2nd_ip 

7329   

7330 -  def Exec(self, feedback_fn): 

7331      """Execute disk replacement. 
7332   
7333      This dispatches the disk replacement to the appropriate handler. 
7334   
7335      """ 
7336      if self.delay_iallocator: 
7337        self._CheckPrereq2() 
7338   
7339      if not self.disks: 
7340        feedback_fn("No disks need replacement") 
7341        return 
7342   
7343      feedback_fn("Replacing disk(s) %s for %s" % 
7344                  (utils.CommaJoin(self.disks), self.instance.name)) 
7345   
7346      activate_disks = (not self.instance.admin_up) 
7347   
7348      # Activate the instance disks if we're replacing them on a down instance 
7349      if activate_disks: 
7350        _StartInstanceDisks(self.lu, self.instance, True) 
7351   
7352      try: 
7353        # Should we replace the secondary node? 
7354        if self.new_node is not None: 
7355          fn = self._ExecDrbd8Secondary 
7356        else: 
7357          fn = self._ExecDrbd8DiskOnly 
7358   
7359        return fn(feedback_fn) 
7360   
7361      finally: 
7362        # Deactivate the instance disks if we're replacing them on a 
7363        # down instance 
7364        if activate_disks: 
7365          _SafeShutdownInstanceDisks(self.lu, self.instance) 

7366   

7367 -  def _CheckVolumeGroup(self, nodes): 

7368      self.lu.LogInfo("Checking volume groups") 
7369   
7370      vgname = self.cfg.GetVGName() 
7371   
7372      # Make sure volume group exists on all involved nodes 
7373      results = self.rpc.call_vg_list(nodes) 
7374      if not results: 
7375        raise errors.OpExecError("Can't list volume groups on the nodes") 
7376   
7377      for node in nodes: 
7378        res = results[node] 
7379        res.Raise("Error checking node %s" % node) 
7380        if vgname not in res.payload: 
7381          raise errors.OpExecError("Volume group '%s' not found on node %s" % 
7382                                   (vgname, node)) 

7383   

7384 -  def _CheckDisksExistence(self, nodes): 

7385      # Check disk existence 
7386      for idx, dev in enumerate(self.instance.disks): 
7387        if idx not in self.disks: 
7388          continue 
7389   
7390        for node in nodes: 
7391          self.lu.LogInfo("Checking disk/%d on %s" % (idx, node)) 
7392          self.cfg.SetDiskID(dev, node) 
7393   
7394          result = self.rpc.call_blockdev_find(node, dev) 
7395   
7396          msg = result.fail_msg 
7397          if msg or not result.payload: 
7398            if not msg: 
7399              msg = "disk not found" 
7400            raise errors.OpExecError("Can't find disk/%d on node %s: %s" % 
7401                                     (idx, node, msg)) 

7402   

7403 -  def _CheckDisksConsistency(self, node_name, on_primary, ldisk): 

7404      for idx, dev in enumerate(self.instance.disks): 
7405        if idx not in self.disks: 
7406          continue 
7407   
7408        self.lu.LogInfo("Checking disk/%d consistency on node %s" % 
7409                        (idx, node_name)) 
7410   
7411        if not _CheckDiskConsistency(self.lu, dev, node_name, on_primary, 
7412                                     ldisk=ldisk): 
7413          raise errors.OpExecError("Node %s has degraded storage, unsafe to" 
7414                                   " replace disks for instance %s" % 
7415                                   (node_name, self.instance.name)) 

7416   

7417 -  def _CreateNewStorage(self, node_name): 

7418      vgname = self.cfg.GetVGName() 
7419      iv_names = {} 
7420   
7421      for idx, dev in enumerate(self.instance.disks): 
7422        if idx not in self.disks: 
7423          continue 
7424   
7425        self.lu.LogInfo("Adding storage on %s for disk/%d" % (node_name, idx)) 
7426   
7427        self.cfg.SetDiskID(dev, node_name) 
7428   
7429        lv_names = [".disk%d_%s" % (idx, suffix) for suffix in ["data", "meta"]] 
7430        names = _GenerateUniqueNames(self.lu, lv_names) 
7431   
7432        lv_data = objects.Disk(dev_type=constants.LD_LV, size=dev.size, 
7433                               logical_id=(vgname, names[0])) 
7434        lv_meta = objects.Disk(dev_type=constants.LD_LV, size=128, 
7435                               logical_id=(vgname, names[1])) 
7436   
7437        new_lvs = [lv_data, lv_meta] 
7438        old_lvs = dev.children 
7439        iv_names[dev.iv_name] = (dev, old_lvs, new_lvs) 
7440   
7441        # we pass force_create=True to force the LVM creation 
7442        for new_lv in new_lvs: 
7443          _CreateBlockDev(self.lu, node_name, self.instance, new_lv, True, 
7444                          _GetInstanceInfoText(self.instance), False) 
7445   
7446      return iv_names 

7447   

7448 -  def _CheckDevices(self, node_name, iv_names): 

7449      for name, (dev, _, _) in iv_names.iteritems(): 
7450        self.cfg.SetDiskID(dev, node_name) 
7451   
7452        result = self.rpc.call_blockdev_find(node_name, dev) 
7453   
7454        msg = result.fail_msg 
7455        if msg or not result.payload: 
7456          if not msg: 
7457            msg = "disk not found" 
7458          raise errors.OpExecError("Can't find DRBD device %s: %s" % 
7459                                   (name, msg)) 
7460   
7461        if result.payload.is_degraded: 
7462          raise errors.OpExecError("DRBD device %s is degraded!" % name) 

7463   

7464 -  def _RemoveOldStorage(self, node_name, iv_names): 

7465      for name, (_, old_lvs, _) in iv_names.iteritems(): 
7466        self.lu.LogInfo("Remove logical volumes for %s" % name) 
7467   
7468        for lv in old_lvs: 
7469          self.cfg.SetDiskID(lv, node_name) 
7470   
7471          msg = self.rpc.call_blockdev_remove(node_name, lv).fail_msg 
7472          if msg: 
7473            self.lu.LogWarning("Can't remove old LV: %s" % msg, 
7474                               hint="remove unused LVs manually") 

7475   

7476 -  def _ReleaseNodeLock(self, node_name): 

7477      """Releases the lock for a given node.""" 
7478      self.lu.context.glm.release(locking.LEVEL_NODE, node_name) 

7479   

7480 -  def _ExecDrbd8DiskOnly(self, feedback_fn): 

7481      """Replace a disk on the primary or secondary for DRBD 8. 
7482   
7483      The algorithm for replace is quite complicated: 
7484   
7485        1. for each disk to be replaced: 
7486   
7487          1. create new LVs on the target node with unique names 
7488          1. detach old LVs from the drbd device 
7489          1. rename old LVs to name_replaced.<time_t> 
7490          1. rename new LVs to old LVs 
7491          1. attach the new LVs (with the old names now) to the drbd device 
7492   
7493        1. wait for sync across all devices 
7494   
7495        1. for each modified disk: 
7496   
7497          1. remove old LVs (which have the name name_replaces.<time_t>) 
7498   
7499      Failures are not very well handled. 
7500   
7501      """ 
7502      steps_total = 6 
7503   
7504      # Step: check device activation 
7505      self.lu.LogStep(1, steps_total, "Check device existence") 
7506      self._CheckDisksExistence([self.other_node, self.target_node]) 
7507      self._CheckVolumeGroup([self.target_node, self.other_node]) 
7508   
7509      # Step: check other node consistency 
7510      self.lu.LogStep(2, steps_total, "Check peer consistency") 
7511      self._CheckDisksConsistency(self.other_node, 
7512                                  self.other_node == self.instance.primary_node, 
7513                                  False) 
7514   
7515      # Step: create new storage 
7516      self.lu.LogStep(3, steps_total, "Allocate new storage") 
7517      iv_names = self._CreateNewStorage(self.target_node) 
7518   
7519      # Step: for each lv, detach+rename*2+attach 
7520      self.lu.LogStep(4, steps_total, "Changing drbd configuration") 
7521      for dev, old_lvs, new_lvs in iv_names.itervalues(): 
7522        self.lu.LogInfo("Detaching %s drbd from local storage" % dev.iv_name) 
7523   
7524        result = self.rpc.call_blockdev_removechildren(self.target_node, dev, 
7525                                                       old_lvs) 
7526        result.Raise("Can't detach drbd from local storage on node" 
7527                     " %s for device %s" % (self.target_node, dev.iv_name)) 
7528        #dev.children = [] 
7529        #cfg.Update(instance) 
7530   
7531        # ok, we created the new LVs, so now we know we have the needed 
7532        # storage; as such, we proceed on the target node to rename 
7533        # old_lv to _old, and new_lv to old_lv; note that we rename LVs 
7534        # using the assumption that logical_id == physical_id (which in 
7535        # turn is the unique_id on that node) 
7536   
7537        # FIXME(iustin): use a better name for the replaced LVs 
7538        temp_suffix = int(time.time()) 
7539        ren_fn = lambda d, suff: (d.physical_id[0], 
7540                                  d.physical_id[1] + "_replaced-%s" % suff) 
7541   
7542        # Build the rename list based on what LVs exist on the node 
7543        rename_old_to_new = [] 
7544        for to_ren in old_lvs: 
7545          result = self.rpc.call_blockdev_find(self.target_node, to_ren) 
7546          if not result.fail_msg and result.payload: 
7547            # device exists 
7548            rename_old_to_new.append((to_ren, ren_fn(to_ren, temp_suffix))) 
7549   
7550        self.lu.LogInfo("Renaming the old LVs on the target node") 
7551        result = self.rpc.call_blockdev_rename(self.target_node, 
7552                                               rename_old_to_new) 
7553        result.Raise("Can't rename old LVs on node %s" % self.target_node) 
7554   
7555        # Now we rename the new LVs to the old LVs 
7556        self.lu.LogInfo("Renaming the new LVs on the target node") 
7557        rename_new_to_old = [(new, old.physical_id) 
7558                             for old, new in zip(old_lvs, new_lvs)] 
7559        result = self.rpc.call_blockdev_rename(self.target_node, 
7560                                               rename_new_to_old) 
7561        result.Raise("Can't rename new LVs on node %s" % self.target_node) 
7562   
7563        for old, new in zip(old_lvs, new_lvs): 
7564          new.logical_id = old.logical_id 
7565          self.cfg.SetDiskID(new, self.target_node) 
7566   
7567        for disk in old_lvs: 
7568          disk.logical_id = ren_fn(disk, temp_suffix) 
7569          self.cfg.SetDiskID(disk, self.target_node) 
7570   
7571        # Now that the new lvs have the old name, we can add them to the device 
7572        self.lu.LogInfo("Adding new mirror component on %s" % self.target_node) 
7573        result = self.rpc.call_blockdev_addchildren(self.target_node, dev, 
7574                                                    new_lvs) 
7575        msg = result.fail_msg 
7576        if msg: 
7577          for new_lv in new_lvs: 
7578            msg2 = self.rpc.call_blockdev_remove(self.target_node, 
7579                                                 new_lv).fail_msg 
7580            if msg2: 
7581              self.lu.LogWarning("Can't rollback device %s: %s", dev, msg2, 
7582                                 hint=("cleanup manually the unused logical" 
7583                                       "volumes")) 
7584          raise errors.OpExecError("Can't add local storage to drbd: %s" % msg) 
7585   
7586        dev.children = new_lvs 
7587   
7588        self.cfg.Update(self.instance, feedback_fn) 
7589   
7590      cstep = 5 
7591      if self.early_release: 
7592        self.lu.LogStep(cstep, steps_total, "Removing old storage") 
7593        cstep += 1 
7594        self._RemoveOldStorage(self.target_node, iv_names) 
7595        # WARNING: we release both node locks here, do not do other RPCs 
7596        # than WaitForSync to the primary node 
7597        self._ReleaseNodeLock([self.target_node, self.other_node]) 
7598   
7599      # Wait for sync 
7600      # This can fail as the old devices are degraded and _WaitForSync 
7601      # does a combined result over all disks, so we don't check its return value 
7602      self.lu.LogStep(cstep, steps_total, "Sync devices") 
7603      cstep += 1 
7604      _WaitForSync(self.lu, self.instance) 
7605   
7606      # Check all devices manually 
7607      self._CheckDevices(self.instance.primary_node, iv_names) 
7608   
7609      # Step: remove old storage 
7610      if not self.early_release: 
7611        self.lu.LogStep(cstep, steps_total, "Removing old storage") 
7612        cstep += 1 
7613        self._RemoveOldStorage(self.target_node, iv_names) 

7614   

7615 -  def _ExecDrbd8Secondary(self, feedback_fn): 

7616      """Replace the secondary node for DRBD 8. 
7617   
7618      The algorithm for replace is quite complicated: 
7619        - for all disks of the instance: 
7620          - create new LVs on the new node with same names 
7621          - shutdown the drbd device on the old secondary 
7622          - disconnect the drbd network on the primary 
7623          - create the drbd device on the new secondary 
7624          - network attach the drbd on the primary, using an artifice: 
7625            the drbd code for Attach() will connect to the network if it 
7626            finds a device which is connected to the good local disks but 
7627            not network enabled 
7628        - wait for sync across all devices 
7629        - remove all disks from the old secondary 
7630   
7631      Failures are not very well handled. 
7632   
7633      """ 
7634      steps_total = 6 
7635   
7636      # Step: check device activation 
7637      self.lu.LogStep(1, steps_total, "Check device existence") 
7638      self._CheckDisksExistence([self.instance.primary_node]) 
7639      self._CheckVolumeGroup([self.instance.primary_node]) 
7640   
7641      # Step: check other node consistency 
7642      self.lu.LogStep(2, steps_total, "Check peer consistency") 
7643      self._CheckDisksConsistency(self.instance.primary_node, True, True) 
7644   
7645      # Step: create new storage 
7646      self.lu.LogStep(3, steps_total, "Allocate new storage") 
7647      for idx, dev in enumerate(self.instance.disks): 
7648        self.lu.LogInfo("Adding new local storage on %s for disk/%d" % 
7649                        (self.new_node, idx)) 
7650        # we pass force_create=True to force LVM creation 
7651        for new_lv in dev.children: 
7652          _CreateBlockDev(self.lu, self.new_node, self.instance, new_lv, True, 
7653                          _GetInstanceInfoText(self.instance), False) 
7654   
7655      # Step 4: dbrd minors and drbd setups changes 
7656      # after this, we must manually remove the drbd minors on both the 
7657      # error and the success paths 
7658      self.lu.LogStep(4, steps_total, "Changing drbd configuration") 
7659      minors = self.cfg.AllocateDRBDMinor([self.new_node 
7660                                           for dev in self.instance.disks], 
7661                                          self.instance.name) 
7662      logging.debug("Allocated minors %r", minors) 
7663   
7664      iv_names = {} 
7665      for idx, (dev, new_minor) in enumerate(zip(self.instance.disks, minors)): 
7666        self.lu.LogInfo("activating a new drbd on %s for disk/%d" % 
7667                        (self.new_node, idx)) 
7668        # create new devices on new_node; note that we create two IDs: 
7669        # one without port, so the drbd will be activated without 
7670        # networking information on the new node at this stage, and one 
7671        # with network, for the latter activation in step 4 
7672        (o_node1, o_node2, o_port, o_minor1, o_minor2, o_secret) = dev.logical_id 
7673        if self.instance.primary_node == o_node1: 
7674          p_minor = o_minor1 
7675        else: 
7676          assert self.instance.primary_node == o_node2, "Three-node instance?" 
7677          p_minor = o_minor2 
7678   
7679        new_alone_id = (self.instance.primary_node, self.new_node, None, 
7680                        p_minor, new_minor, o_secret) 
7681        new_net_id = (self.instance.primary_node, self.new_node, o_port, 
7682                      p_minor, new_minor, o_secret) 
7683   
7684        iv_names[idx] = (dev, dev.children, new_net_id) 
7685        logging.debug("Allocated new_minor: %s, new_logical_id: %s", new_minor, 
7686                      new_net_id) 
7687        new_drbd = objects.Disk(dev_type=constants.LD_DRBD8, 
7688                                logical_id=new_alone_id, 
7689                                children=dev.children, 
7690                                size=dev.size) 
7691        try: 
7692          _CreateSingleBlockDev(self.lu, self.new_node, self.instance, new_drbd, 
7693                                _GetInstanceInfoText(self.instance), False) 
7694        except errors.GenericError: 
7695          self.cfg.ReleaseDRBDMinors(self.instance.name) 
7696          raise 
7697   
7698      # We have new devices, shutdown the drbd on the old secondary 
7699      for idx, dev in enumerate(self.instance.disks): 
7700        self.lu.LogInfo("Shutting down drbd for disk/%d on old node" % idx) 
7701        self.cfg.SetDiskID(dev, self.target_node) 
7702        msg = self.rpc.call_blockdev_shutdown(self.target_node, dev).fail_msg 
7703        if msg: 
7704          self.lu.LogWarning("Failed to shutdown drbd for disk/%d on old" 
7705                             "node: %s" % (idx, msg), 
7706                             hint=("Please cleanup this device manually as" 
7707                                   " soon as possible")) 
7708   
7709      self.lu.LogInfo("Detaching primary drbds from the network (=> standalone)") 
7710      result = self.rpc.call_drbd_disconnect_net([self.instance.primary_node], 
7711                                                 self.node_secondary_ip, 
7712                                                 self.instance.disks)\ 
7713                                                [self.instance.primary_node] 
7714   
7715      msg = result.fail_msg 
7716      if msg: 
7717        # detaches didn't succeed (unlikely) 
7718        self.cfg.ReleaseDRBDMinors(self.instance.name) 
7719        raise errors.OpExecError("Can't detach the disks from the network on" 
7720                                 " old node: %s" % (msg,)) 
7721   
7722      # if we managed to detach at least one, we update all the disks of 
7723      # the instance to point to the new secondary 
7724      self.lu.LogInfo("Updating instance configuration") 
7725      for dev, _, new_logical_id in iv_names.itervalues(): 
7726        dev.logical_id = new_logical_id 
7727        self.cfg.SetDiskID(dev, self.instance.primary_node) 
7728   
7729      self.cfg.Update(self.instance, feedback_fn) 
7730   
7731      # and now perform the drbd attach 
7732      self.lu.LogInfo("Attaching primary drbds to new secondary" 
7733                      " (standalone => connected)") 
7734      result = self.rpc.call_drbd_attach_net([self.instance.primary_node, 
7735                                              self.new_node], 
7736                                             self.node_secondary_ip, 
7737                                             self.instance.disks, 
7738                                             self.instance.name, 
7739                                             False) 
7740      for to_node, to_result in result.items(): 
7741        msg = to_result.fail_msg 
7742        if msg: 
7743          self.lu.LogWarning("Can't attach drbd disks on node %s: %s", 
7744                             to_node, msg, 
7745                             hint=("please do a gnt-instance info to see the" 
7746                                   " status of disks")) 
7747      cstep = 5 
7748      if self.early_release: 
7749        self.lu.LogStep(cstep, steps_total, "Removing old storage") 
7750        cstep += 1 
7751        self._RemoveOldStorage(self.target_node, iv_names) 
7752        # WARNING: we release all node locks here, do not do other RPCs 
7753        # than WaitForSync to the primary node 
7754        self._ReleaseNodeLock([self.instance.primary_node, 
7755                               self.target_node, 
7756                               self.new_node]) 
7757   
7758      # Wait for sync 
7759      # This can fail as the old devices are degraded and _WaitForSync 
7760      # does a combined result over all disks, so we don't check its return value 
7761      self.lu.LogStep(cstep, steps_total, "Sync devices") 
7762      cstep += 1 
7763      _WaitForSync(self.lu, self.instance) 
7764   
7765      # Check all devices manually 
7766      self._CheckDevices(self.instance.primary_node, iv_names) 
7767   
7768      # Step: remove old storage 
7769      if not self.early_release: 
7770        self.lu.LogStep(cstep, steps_total, "Removing old storage") 
7771        self._RemoveOldStorage(self.target_node, iv_names) 

7772   

7773

7823        for inst_node_name in check_nodes: 
7824          self._CheckFaultyDisks(inst, inst_node_name)

7887          raise errors.OpExecError("No valid evacuation solution: %s" % ial.info, 
7888                                   errors.ECODE_NORES) 
7889        result = ial.result 
7890      return result

8035 -  def _ComputeBlockdevStatus(self, node, instance_name, dev): 

8036      """Returns the status of a block device 
8037   
8038      """ 
8039      if self.op.static or not node: 
8040        return None 
8041   
8042      self.cfg.SetDiskID(dev, node) 
8043   
8044      result = self.rpc.call_blockdev_find(node, dev) 
8045      if result.offline: 
8046        return None 
8047

8049

8051      if status is None: 
8052        return None 
8053

8055              status.sync_percent, status.estimated_time,

8058 -  def _ComputeDiskStatus(self, instance, snode, dev):

8061      """ 
8062      if dev.dev_type in constants.LDS_DRBD: 
8063        # we change the snode then (otherwise we use the one passed in) 
8064        if dev.logical_id[0] == instance.primary_node: 
8065          snode = dev.logical_id[1] 
8066        else: 
8067          snode = dev.logical_id[0]

8070                                                instance.name, dev) 
8071      dev_sstatus = self._ComputeBlockdevStatus(snode, instance.name, dev) 
8072   
8073      if dev.children: 
8074        dev_children = [self._ComputeDiskStatus(instance, snode, child) 
8075                        for child in dev.children] 
8076      else: 
8077        dev_children = [] 
8078   
8079      data = {

8093 -  def Exec(self, feedback_fn): 

8094      """Gather and return data"""

8102                                                    instance.name, 
8103                                                    instance.hypervisor)

8106          if remote_info and "state" in remote_info: 
8107            remote_state = "up" 
8108          else: 
8109            remote_state = "down"

8111          remote_state = None

8113          config_state = "up"

8115          config_state = "down"

8118                 for device in instance.disks]

8122          "config_state": config_state, 
8123          "run_state": remote_state, 
8124          "pnode": instance.primary_node, 
8125          "snodes": instance.secondary_nodes, 
8126          "os": instance.os, 
8127          # this happens to be the same format used for hooks 
8128          "nics": _NICListToTuple(self, instance.nics), 
8129          "disk_template": instance.disk_template, 
8130          "disks": disks, 
8131          "hypervisor": instance.hypervisor, 
8132          "network_port": instance.network_port,

8134          "hv_actual": cluster.FillHV(instance, skip_globals=True),
