8148 -class LUSetInstanceParams(LogicalUnit): 

8149    """Modifies an instances's parameters. 
8150   
8151    """ 
8152    HPATH = "instance-modify" 
8153    HTYPE = constants.HTYPE_INSTANCE 
8154    _OP_REQP = ["instance_name"] 
8155    REQ_BGL = False 
8156   

8157 -  def CheckArguments(self): 

8158      if not hasattr(self.op, 'nics'): 
8159        self.op.nics = [] 
8160      if not hasattr(self.op, 'disks'): 
8161        self.op.disks = [] 
8162      if not hasattr(self.op, 'beparams'): 
8163        self.op.beparams = {} 
8164      if not hasattr(self.op, 'hvparams'): 
8165        self.op.hvparams = {} 
8166      if not hasattr(self.op, "disk_template"): 
8167        self.op.disk_template = None 
8168      if not hasattr(self.op, "remote_node"): 
8169        self.op.remote_node = None 
8170      if not hasattr(self.op, "os_name"): 
8171        self.op.os_name = None 
8172      if not hasattr(self.op, "force_variant"): 
8173        self.op.force_variant = False 
8174      self.op.force = getattr(self.op, "force", False) 
8175      if not (self.op.nics or self.op.disks or self.op.disk_template or 
8176              self.op.hvparams or self.op.beparams or self.op.os_name): 
8177        raise errors.OpPrereqError("No changes submitted", errors.ECODE_INVAL) 
8178   
8179      if self.op.hvparams: 
8180        _CheckGlobalHvParams(self.op.hvparams) 
8181   
8182      # Disk validation 
8183      disk_addremove = 0 
8184      for disk_op, disk_dict in self.op.disks: 
8185        utils.ForceDictType(disk_dict, constants.IDISK_PARAMS_TYPES) 
8186        if disk_op == constants.DDM_REMOVE: 
8187          disk_addremove += 1 
8188          continue 
8189        elif disk_op == constants.DDM_ADD: 
8190          disk_addremove += 1 
8191        else: 
8192          if not isinstance(disk_op, int): 
8193            raise errors.OpPrereqError("Invalid disk index", errors.ECODE_INVAL) 
8194          if not isinstance(disk_dict, dict): 
8195            msg = "Invalid disk value: expected dict, got '%s'" % disk_dict 
8196            raise errors.OpPrereqError(msg, errors.ECODE_INVAL) 
8197   
8198        if disk_op == constants.DDM_ADD: 
8199          mode = disk_dict.setdefault('mode', constants.DISK_RDWR) 
8200          if mode not in constants.DISK_ACCESS_SET: 
8201            raise errors.OpPrereqError("Invalid disk access mode '%s'" % mode, 
8202                                       errors.ECODE_INVAL) 
8203          size = disk_dict.get('size', None) 
8204          if size is None: 
8205            raise errors.OpPrereqError("Required disk parameter size missing", 
8206                                       errors.ECODE_INVAL) 
8207          try: 
8208            size = int(size) 
8209          except (TypeError, ValueError), err: 
8210            raise errors.OpPrereqError("Invalid disk size parameter: %s" % 
8211                                       str(err), errors.ECODE_INVAL) 
8212          disk_dict['size'] = size 
8213        else: 
8214          # modification of disk 
8215          if 'size' in disk_dict: 
8216            raise errors.OpPrereqError("Disk size change not possible, use" 
8217                                       " grow-disk", errors.ECODE_INVAL) 
8218   
8219      if disk_addremove > 1: 
8220        raise errors.OpPrereqError("Only one disk add or remove operation" 
8221                                   " supported at a time", errors.ECODE_INVAL) 
8222   
8223      if self.op.disks and self.op.disk_template is not None: 
8224        raise errors.OpPrereqError("Disk template conversion and other disk" 
8225                                   " changes not supported at the same time", 
8226                                   errors.ECODE_INVAL) 
8227   
8228      if self.op.disk_template: 
8229        _CheckDiskTemplate(self.op.disk_template) 
8230        if (self.op.disk_template in constants.DTS_NET_MIRROR and 
8231            self.op.remote_node is None): 
8232          raise errors.OpPrereqError("Changing the disk template to a mirrored" 
8233                                     " one requires specifying a secondary node", 
8234                                     errors.ECODE_INVAL) 
8235   
8236      # NIC validation 
8237      nic_addremove = 0 
8238      for nic_op, nic_dict in self.op.nics: 
8239        utils.ForceDictType(nic_dict, constants.INIC_PARAMS_TYPES) 
8240        if nic_op == constants.DDM_REMOVE: 
8241          nic_addremove += 1 
8242          continue 
8243        elif nic_op == constants.DDM_ADD: 
8244          nic_addremove += 1 
8245        else: 
8246          if not isinstance(nic_op, int): 
8247            raise errors.OpPrereqError("Invalid nic index", errors.ECODE_INVAL) 
8248          if not isinstance(nic_dict, dict): 
8249            msg = "Invalid nic value: expected dict, got '%s'" % nic_dict 
8250            raise errors.OpPrereqError(msg, errors.ECODE_INVAL) 
8251   
8252        # nic_dict should be a dict 
8253        nic_ip = nic_dict.get('ip', None) 
8254        if nic_ip is not None: 
8255          if nic_ip.lower() == constants.VALUE_NONE: 
8256            nic_dict['ip'] = None 
8257          else: 
8258            if not utils.IsValidIP(nic_ip): 
8259              raise errors.OpPrereqError("Invalid IP address '%s'" % nic_ip, 
8260                                         errors.ECODE_INVAL) 
8261   
8262        nic_bridge = nic_dict.get('bridge', None) 
8263        nic_link = nic_dict.get('link', None) 
8264        if nic_bridge and nic_link: 
8265          raise errors.OpPrereqError("Cannot pass 'bridge' and 'link'" 
8266                                     " at the same time", errors.ECODE_INVAL) 
8267        elif nic_bridge and nic_bridge.lower() == constants.VALUE_NONE: 
8268          nic_dict['bridge'] = None 
8269        elif nic_link and nic_link.lower() == constants.VALUE_NONE: 
8270          nic_dict['link'] = None 
8271   
8272        if nic_op == constants.DDM_ADD: 
8273          nic_mac = nic_dict.get('mac', None) 
8274          if nic_mac is None: 
8275            nic_dict['mac'] = constants.VALUE_AUTO 
8276   
8277        if 'mac' in nic_dict: 
8278          nic_mac = nic_dict['mac'] 
8279          if nic_mac not in (constants.VALUE_AUTO, constants.VALUE_GENERATE): 
8280            nic_mac = utils.NormalizeAndValidateMac(nic_mac) 
8281   
8282          if nic_op != constants.DDM_ADD and nic_mac == constants.VALUE_AUTO: 
8283            raise errors.OpPrereqError("'auto' is not a valid MAC address when" 
8284                                       " modifying an existing nic", 
8285                                       errors.ECODE_INVAL) 
8286   
8287      if nic_addremove > 1: 
8288        raise errors.OpPrereqError("Only one NIC add or remove operation" 
8289                                   " supported at a time", errors.ECODE_INVAL) 

8290   

8291 -  def ExpandNames(self): 

8292      self._ExpandAndLockInstance() 
8293      self.needed_locks[locking.LEVEL_NODE] = [] 
8294      self.recalculate_locks[locking.LEVEL_NODE] = constants.LOCKS_REPLACE 

8295   

8296 -  def DeclareLocks(self, level): 

8297      if level == locking.LEVEL_NODE: 
8298        self._LockInstancesNodes() 
8299        if self.op.disk_template and self.op.remote_node: 
8300          self.op.remote_node = _ExpandNodeName(self.cfg, self.op.remote_node) 
8301          self.needed_locks[locking.LEVEL_NODE].append(self.op.remote_node) 

8302   

8303 -  def BuildHooksEnv(self): 

8304      """Build hooks env. 
8305   
8306      This runs on the master, primary and secondaries. 
8307   
8308      """ 
8309      args = dict() 
8310      if constants.BE_MEMORY in self.be_new: 
8311        args['memory'] = self.be_new[constants.BE_MEMORY] 
8312      if constants.BE_VCPUS in self.be_new: 
8313        args['vcpus'] = self.be_new[constants.BE_VCPUS] 
8314      # TODO: export disk changes. Note: _BuildInstanceHookEnv* don't export disk 
8315      # information at all. 
8316      if self.op.nics: 
8317        args['nics'] = [] 
8318        nic_override = dict(self.op.nics) 
8319        c_nicparams = self.cluster.nicparams[constants.PP_DEFAULT] 
8320        for idx, nic in enumerate(self.instance.nics): 
8321          if idx in nic_override: 
8322            this_nic_override = nic_override[idx] 
8323          else: 
8324            this_nic_override = {} 
8325          if 'ip' in this_nic_override: 
8326            ip = this_nic_override['ip'] 
8327          else: 
8328            ip = nic.ip 
8329          if 'mac' in this_nic_override: 
8330            mac = this_nic_override['mac'] 
8331          else: 
8332            mac = nic.mac 
8333          if idx in self.nic_pnew: 
8334            nicparams = self.nic_pnew[idx] 
8335          else: 
8336            nicparams = objects.FillDict(c_nicparams, nic.nicparams) 
8337          mode = nicparams[constants.NIC_MODE] 
8338          link = nicparams[constants.NIC_LINK] 
8339          args['nics'].append((ip, mac, mode, link)) 
8340        if constants.DDM_ADD in nic_override: 
8341          ip = nic_override[constants.DDM_ADD].get('ip', None) 
8342          mac = nic_override[constants.DDM_ADD]['mac'] 
8343          nicparams = self.nic_pnew[constants.DDM_ADD] 
8344          mode = nicparams[constants.NIC_MODE] 
8345          link = nicparams[constants.NIC_LINK] 
8346          args['nics'].append((ip, mac, mode, link)) 
8347        elif constants.DDM_REMOVE in nic_override: 
8348          del args['nics'][-1] 
8349   
8350      env = _BuildInstanceHookEnvByObject(self, self.instance, override=args) 
8351      if self.op.disk_template: 
8352        env["NEW_DISK_TEMPLATE"] = self.op.disk_template 
8353      nl = [self.cfg.GetMasterNode()] + list(self.instance.all_nodes) 
8354      return env, nl, nl 

8355   
8356    @staticmethod 

8357 -  def _GetUpdatedParams(old_params, update_dict, 
8358                          default_values, parameter_types): 

8359      """Return the new params dict for the given params. 
8360   
8361      @type old_params: dict 
8362      @param old_params: old parameters 
8363      @type update_dict: dict 
8364      @param update_dict: dict containing new parameter values, 
8365                          or constants.VALUE_DEFAULT to reset the 
8366                          parameter to its default value 
8367      @type default_values: dict 
8368      @param default_values: default values for the filled parameters 
8369      @type parameter_types: dict 
8370      @param parameter_types: dict mapping target dict keys to types 
8371                              in constants.ENFORCEABLE_TYPES 
8372      @rtype: (dict, dict) 
8373      @return: (new_parameters, filled_parameters) 
8374   
8375      """ 
8376      params_copy = copy.deepcopy(old_params) 
8377      for key, val in update_dict.iteritems(): 
8378        if val == constants.VALUE_DEFAULT: 
8379          try: 
8380            del params_copy[key] 
8381          except KeyError: 
8382            pass 
8383        else: 
8384          params_copy[key] = val 
8385      utils.ForceDictType(params_copy, parameter_types) 
8386      params_filled = objects.FillDict(default_values, params_copy) 
8387      return (params_copy, params_filled) 

8388   

8389 -  def CheckPrereq(self): 

8390      """Check prerequisites. 
8391   
8392      This only checks the instance list against the existing names. 
8393   
8394      """ 
8395      self.force = self.op.force 
8396   
8397      # checking the new params on the primary/secondary nodes 
8398   
8399      instance = self.instance = self.cfg.GetInstanceInfo(self.op.instance_name) 
8400      cluster = self.cluster = self.cfg.GetClusterInfo() 
8401      assert self.instance is not None, \ 
8402        "Cannot retrieve locked instance %s" % self.op.instance_name 
8403      pnode = instance.primary_node 
8404      nodelist = list(instance.all_nodes) 
8405   
8406      if self.op.disk_template: 
8407        if instance.disk_template == self.op.disk_template: 
8408          raise errors.OpPrereqError("Instance already has disk template %s" % 
8409                                     instance.disk_template, errors.ECODE_INVAL) 
8410   
8411        if (instance.disk_template, 
8412            self.op.disk_template) not in self._DISK_CONVERSIONS: 
8413          raise errors.OpPrereqError("Unsupported disk template conversion from" 
8414                                     " %s to %s" % (instance.disk_template, 
8415                                                    self.op.disk_template), 
8416                                     errors.ECODE_INVAL) 
8417        _CheckInstanceDown(self, instance, "cannot change disk template") 
8418        if self.op.disk_template in constants.DTS_NET_MIRROR: 
8419          if self.op.remote_node == pnode: 
8420            raise errors.OpPrereqError("Given new secondary node %s is the same" 
8421                                       " as the primary node of the instance" % 
8422                                       self.op.remote_node, errors.ECODE_STATE) 
8423          _CheckNodeOnline(self, self.op.remote_node) 
8424          _CheckNodeNotDrained(self, self.op.remote_node) 
8425          disks = [{"size": d.size} for d in instance.disks] 
8426          required = _ComputeDiskSize(self.op.disk_template, disks) 
8427          _CheckNodesFreeDisk(self, [self.op.remote_node], required) 
8428   
8429      # hvparams processing 
8430      if self.op.hvparams: 
8431        i_hvdict, hv_new = self._GetUpdatedParams( 
8432                               instance.hvparams, self.op.hvparams, 
8433                               cluster.hvparams[instance.hypervisor], 
8434                               constants.HVS_PARAMETER_TYPES) 
8435        # local check 
8436        hypervisor.GetHypervisor( 
8437          instance.hypervisor).CheckParameterSyntax(hv_new) 
8438        _CheckHVParams(self, nodelist, instance.hypervisor, hv_new) 
8439        self.hv_new = hv_new # the new actual values 
8440        self.hv_inst = i_hvdict # the new dict (without defaults) 
8441      else: 
8442        self.hv_new = self.hv_inst = {} 
8443   
8444      # beparams processing 
8445      if self.op.beparams: 
8446        i_bedict, be_new = self._GetUpdatedParams( 
8447                               instance.beparams, self.op.beparams, 
8448                               cluster.beparams[constants.PP_DEFAULT], 
8449                               constants.BES_PARAMETER_TYPES) 
8450        self.be_new = be_new # the new actual values 
8451        self.be_inst = i_bedict # the new dict (without defaults) 
8452      else: 
8453        self.be_new = self.be_inst = {} 
8454   
8455      self.warn = [] 
8456   
8457      if constants.BE_MEMORY in self.op.beparams and not self.force: 
8458        mem_check_list = [pnode] 
8459        if be_new[constants.BE_AUTO_BALANCE]: 
8460          # either we changed auto_balance to yes or it was from before 
8461          mem_check_list.extend(instance.secondary_nodes) 
8462        instance_info = self.rpc.call_instance_info(pnode, instance.name, 
8463                                                    instance.hypervisor) 
8464        nodeinfo = self.rpc.call_node_info(mem_check_list, self.cfg.GetVGName(), 
8465                                           instance.hypervisor) 
8466        pninfo = nodeinfo[pnode] 
8467        msg = pninfo.fail_msg 
8468        if msg: 
8469          # Assume the primary node is unreachable and go ahead 
8470          self.warn.append("Can't get info from primary node %s: %s" % 
8471                           (pnode,  msg)) 
8472        elif not isinstance(pninfo.payload.get('memory_free', None), int): 
8473          self.warn.append("Node data from primary node %s doesn't contain" 
8474                           " free memory information" % pnode) 
8475        elif instance_info.fail_msg: 
8476          self.warn.append("Can't get instance runtime information: %s" % 
8477                          instance_info.fail_msg) 
8478        else: 
8479          if instance_info.payload: 
8480            current_mem = int(instance_info.payload['memory']) 
8481          else: 
8482            # Assume instance not running 
8483            # (there is a slight race condition here, but it's not very probable, 
8484            # and we have no other way to check) 
8485            current_mem = 0 
8486          miss_mem = (be_new[constants.BE_MEMORY] - current_mem - 
8487                      pninfo.payload['memory_free']) 
8488          if miss_mem > 0: 
8489            raise errors.OpPrereqError("This change will prevent the instance" 
8490                                       " from starting, due to %d MB of memory" 
8491                                       " missing on its primary node" % miss_mem, 
8492                                       errors.ECODE_NORES) 
8493   
8494        if be_new[constants.BE_AUTO_BALANCE]: 
8495          for node, nres in nodeinfo.items(): 
8496            if node not in instance.secondary_nodes: 
8497              continue 
8498            msg = nres.fail_msg 
8499            if msg: 
8500              self.warn.append("Can't get info from secondary node %s: %s" % 
8501                               (node, msg)) 
8502            elif not isinstance(nres.payload.get('memory_free', None), int): 
8503              self.warn.append("Secondary node %s didn't return free" 
8504                               " memory information" % node) 
8505            elif be_new[constants.BE_MEMORY] > nres.payload['memory_free']: 
8506              self.warn.append("Not enough memory to failover instance to" 
8507                               " secondary node %s" % node) 
8508   
8509      # NIC processing 
8510      self.nic_pnew = {} 
8511      self.nic_pinst = {} 
8512      for nic_op, nic_dict in self.op.nics: 
8513        if nic_op == constants.DDM_REMOVE: 
8514          if not instance.nics: 
8515            raise errors.OpPrereqError("Instance has no NICs, cannot remove", 
8516                                       errors.ECODE_INVAL) 
8517          continue 
8518        if nic_op != constants.DDM_ADD: 
8519          # an existing nic 
8520          if not instance.nics: 
8521            raise errors.OpPrereqError("Invalid NIC index %s, instance has" 
8522                                       " no NICs" % nic_op, 
8523                                       errors.ECODE_INVAL) 
8524          if nic_op < 0 or nic_op >= len(instance.nics): 
8525            raise errors.OpPrereqError("Invalid NIC index %s, valid values" 
8526                                       " are 0 to %d" % 
8527                                       (nic_op, len(instance.nics) - 1), 
8528                                       errors.ECODE_INVAL) 
8529          old_nic_params = instance.nics[nic_op].nicparams 
8530          old_nic_ip = instance.nics[nic_op].ip 
8531        else: 
8532          old_nic_params = {} 
8533          old_nic_ip = None 
8534   
8535        update_params_dict = dict([(key, nic_dict[key]) 
8536                                   for key in constants.NICS_PARAMETERS 
8537                                   if key in nic_dict]) 
8538   
8539        if 'bridge' in nic_dict: 
8540          update_params_dict[constants.NIC_LINK] = nic_dict['bridge'] 
8541   
8542        new_nic_params, new_filled_nic_params = \ 
8543            self._GetUpdatedParams(old_nic_params, update_params_dict, 
8544                                   cluster.nicparams[constants.PP_DEFAULT], 
8545                                   constants.NICS_PARAMETER_TYPES) 
8546        objects.NIC.CheckParameterSyntax(new_filled_nic_params) 
8547        self.nic_pinst[nic_op] = new_nic_params 
8548        self.nic_pnew[nic_op] = new_filled_nic_params 
8549        new_nic_mode = new_filled_nic_params[constants.NIC_MODE] 
8550   
8551        if new_nic_mode == constants.NIC_MODE_BRIDGED: 
8552          nic_bridge = new_filled_nic_params[constants.NIC_LINK] 
8553          msg = self.rpc.call_bridges_exist(pnode, [nic_bridge]).fail_msg 
8554          if msg: 
8555            msg = "Error checking bridges on node %s: %s" % (pnode, msg) 
8556            if self.force: 
8557              self.warn.append(msg) 
8558            else: 
8559              raise errors.OpPrereqError(msg, errors.ECODE_ENVIRON) 
8560        if new_nic_mode == constants.NIC_MODE_ROUTED: 
8561          if 'ip' in nic_dict: 
8562            nic_ip = nic_dict['ip'] 
8563          else: 
8564            nic_ip = old_nic_ip 
8565          if nic_ip is None: 
8566            raise errors.OpPrereqError('Cannot set the nic ip to None' 
8567                                       ' on a routed nic', errors.ECODE_INVAL) 
8568        if 'mac' in nic_dict: 
8569          nic_mac = nic_dict['mac'] 
8570          if nic_mac is None: 
8571            raise errors.OpPrereqError('Cannot set the nic mac to None', 
8572                                       errors.ECODE_INVAL) 
8573          elif nic_mac in (constants.VALUE_AUTO, constants.VALUE_GENERATE): 
8574            # otherwise generate the mac 
8575            nic_dict['mac'] = self.cfg.GenerateMAC(self.proc.GetECId()) 
8576          else: 
8577            # or validate/reserve the current one 
8578            try: 
8579              self.cfg.ReserveMAC(nic_mac, self.proc.GetECId()) 
8580            except errors.ReservationError: 
8581              raise errors.OpPrereqError("MAC address %s already in use" 
8582                                         " in cluster" % nic_mac, 
8583                                         errors.ECODE_NOTUNIQUE) 
8584   
8585      # DISK processing 
8586      if self.op.disks and instance.disk_template == constants.DT_DISKLESS: 
8587        raise errors.OpPrereqError("Disk operations not supported for" 
8588                                   " diskless instances", 
8589                                   errors.ECODE_INVAL) 
8590      for disk_op, _ in self.op.disks: 
8591        if disk_op == constants.DDM_REMOVE: 
8592          if len(instance.disks) == 1: 
8593            raise errors.OpPrereqError("Cannot remove the last disk of" 
8594                                       " an instance", errors.ECODE_INVAL) 
8595          _CheckInstanceDown(self, instance, "cannot remove disks") 
8596   
8597        if (disk_op == constants.DDM_ADD and 
8598            len(instance.nics) >= constants.MAX_DISKS): 
8599          raise errors.OpPrereqError("Instance has too many disks (%d), cannot" 
8600                                     " add more" % constants.MAX_DISKS, 
8601                                     errors.ECODE_STATE) 
8602        if disk_op not in (constants.DDM_ADD, constants.DDM_REMOVE): 
8603          # an existing disk 
8604          if disk_op < 0 or disk_op >= len(instance.disks): 
8605            raise errors.OpPrereqError("Invalid disk index %s, valid values" 
8606                                       " are 0 to %d" % 
8607                                       (disk_op, len(instance.disks)), 
8608                                       errors.ECODE_INVAL) 
8609   
8610      # OS change 
8611      if self.op.os_name and not self.op.force: 
8612        _CheckNodeHasOS(self, instance.primary_node, self.op.os_name, 
8613                        self.op.force_variant) 
8614   
8615      return 

8616   

8617 -  def _ConvertPlainToDrbd(self, feedback_fn): 

8618      """Converts an instance from plain to drbd. 
8619   
8620      """ 
8621      feedback_fn("Converting template to drbd") 
8622      instance = self.instance 
8623      pnode = instance.primary_node 
8624      snode = self.op.remote_node 
8625   
8626      # create a fake disk info for _GenerateDiskTemplate 
8627      disk_info = [{"size": d.size, "mode": d.mode} for d in instance.disks] 
8628      new_disks = _GenerateDiskTemplate(self, self.op.disk_template, 
8629                                        instance.name, pnode, [snode], 
8630                                        disk_info, None, None, 0) 
8631      info = _GetInstanceInfoText(instance) 
8632      feedback_fn("Creating aditional volumes...") 
8633      # first, create the missing data and meta devices 
8634      for disk in new_disks: 
8635        # unfortunately this is... not too nice 
8636        _CreateSingleBlockDev(self, pnode, instance, disk.children[1], 
8637                              info, True) 
8638        for child in disk.children: 
8639          _CreateSingleBlockDev(self, snode, instance, child, info, True) 
8640      # at this stage, all new LVs have been created, we can rename the 
8641      # old ones 
8642      feedback_fn("Renaming original volumes...") 
8643      rename_list = [(o, n.children[0].logical_id) 
8644                     for (o, n) in zip(instance.disks, new_disks)] 
8645      result = self.rpc.call_blockdev_rename(pnode, rename_list) 
8646      result.Raise("Failed to rename original LVs") 
8647   
8648      feedback_fn("Initializing DRBD devices...") 
8649      # all child devices are in place, we can now create the DRBD devices 
8650      for disk in new_disks: 
8651        for node in [pnode, snode]: 
8652          f_create = node == pnode 
8653          _CreateSingleBlockDev(self, node, instance, disk, info, f_create) 
8654   
8655      # at this point, the instance has been modified 
8656      instance.disk_template = constants.DT_DRBD8 
8657      instance.disks = new_disks 
8658      self.cfg.Update(instance, feedback_fn) 
8659   
8660      # disks are created, waiting for sync 
8661      disk_abort = not _WaitForSync(self, instance) 
8662      if disk_abort: 
8663        raise errors.OpExecError("There are some degraded disks for" 
8664                                 " this instance, please cleanup manually") 

8665   

8666 -  def _ConvertDrbdToPlain(self, feedback_fn): 

8667      """Converts an instance from drbd to plain. 
8668   
8669      """ 
8670      instance = self.instance 
8671      assert len(instance.secondary_nodes) == 1 
8672      pnode = instance.primary_node 
8673      snode = instance.secondary_nodes[0] 
8674      feedback_fn("Converting template to plain") 
8675   
8676      old_disks = instance.disks 
8677      new_disks = [d.children[0] for d in old_disks] 
8678   
8679      # copy over size and mode 
8680      for parent, child in zip(old_disks, new_disks): 
8681        child.size = parent.size 
8682        child.mode = parent.mode 
8683   
8684      # update instance structure 
8685      instance.disks = new_disks 
8686      instance.disk_template = constants.DT_PLAIN 
8687      self.cfg.Update(instance, feedback_fn) 
8688   
8689      feedback_fn("Removing volumes on the secondary node...") 
8690      for disk in old_disks: 
8691        self.cfg.SetDiskID(disk, snode) 
8692        msg = self.rpc.call_blockdev_remove(snode, disk).fail_msg 
8693        if msg: 
8694          self.LogWarning("Could not remove block device %s on node %s," 
8695                          " continuing anyway: %s", disk.iv_name, snode, msg) 
8696   
8697      feedback_fn("Removing unneeded volumes on the primary node...") 
8698      for idx, disk in enumerate(old_disks): 
8699        meta = disk.children[1] 
8700        self.cfg.SetDiskID(meta, pnode) 
8701        msg = self.rpc.call_blockdev_remove(pnode, meta).fail_msg 
8702        if msg: 
8703          self.LogWarning("Could not remove metadata for disk %d on node %s," 
8704                          " continuing anyway: %s", idx, pnode, msg) 

8705   
8706   

8707 -  def Exec(self, feedback_fn): 

8708      """Modifies an instance. 
8709   
8710      All parameters take effect only at the next restart of the instance. 
8711   
8712      """ 
8713      # Process here the warnings from CheckPrereq, as we don't have a 
8714      # feedback_fn there. 
8715      for warn in self.warn: 
8716        feedback_fn("WARNING: %s" % warn) 
8717   
8718      result = [] 
8719      instance = self.instance 
8720      # disk changes 
8721      for disk_op, disk_dict in self.op.disks: 
8722        if disk_op == constants.DDM_REMOVE: 
8723          # remove the last disk 
8724          device = instance.disks.pop() 
8725          device_idx = len(instance.disks) 
8726          for node, disk in device.ComputeNodeTree(instance.primary_node): 
8727            self.cfg.SetDiskID(disk, node) 
8728            msg = self.rpc.call_blockdev_remove(node, disk).fail_msg 
8729            if msg: 
8730              self.LogWarning("Could not remove disk/%d on node %s: %s," 
8731                              " continuing anyway", device_idx, node, msg) 
8732          result.append(("disk/%d" % device_idx, "remove")) 
8733        elif disk_op == constants.DDM_ADD: 
8734          # add a new disk 
8735          if instance.disk_template == constants.DT_FILE: 
8736            file_driver, file_path = instance.disks[0].logical_id 
8737            file_path = os.path.dirname(file_path) 
8738          else: 
8739            file_driver = file_path = None 
8740          disk_idx_base = len(instance.disks) 
8741          new_disk = _GenerateDiskTemplate(self, 
8742                                           instance.disk_template, 
8743                                           instance.name, instance.primary_node, 
8744                                           instance.secondary_nodes, 
8745                                           [disk_dict], 
8746                                           file_path, 
8747                                           file_driver, 
8748                                           disk_idx_base)[0] 
8749          instance.disks.append(new_disk) 
8750          info = _GetInstanceInfoText(instance) 
8751   
8752          logging.info("Creating volume %s for instance %s", 
8753                       new_disk.iv_name, instance.name) 
8754          # Note: this needs to be kept in sync with _CreateDisks 
8755          #HARDCODE 
8756          for node in instance.all_nodes: 
8757            f_create = node == instance.primary_node 
8758            try: 
8759              _CreateBlockDev(self, node, instance, new_disk, 
8760                              f_create, info, f_create) 
8761            except errors.OpExecError, err: 
8762              self.LogWarning("Failed to create volume %s (%s) on" 
8763                              " node %s: %s", 
8764                              new_disk.iv_name, new_disk, node, err) 
8765          result.append(("disk/%d" % disk_idx_base, "add:size=%s,mode=%s" % 
8766                         (new_disk.size, new_disk.mode))) 
8767        else: 
8768          # change a given disk 
8769          instance.disks[disk_op].mode = disk_dict['mode'] 
8770          result.append(("disk.mode/%d" % disk_op, disk_dict['mode'])) 
8771   
8772      if self.op.disk_template: 
8773        r_shut = _ShutdownInstanceDisks(self, instance) 
8774        if not r_shut: 
8775          raise errors.OpExecError("Cannot shutdow instance disks, unable to" 
8776                                   " proceed with disk template conversion") 
8777        mode = (instance.disk_template, self.op.disk_template) 
8778        try: 
8779          self._DISK_CONVERSIONS[mode](self, feedback_fn) 
8780        except: 
8781          self.cfg.ReleaseDRBDMinors(instance.name) 
8782          raise 
8783        result.append(("disk_template", self.op.disk_template)) 
8784   
8785      # NIC changes 
8786      for nic_op, nic_dict in self.op.nics: 
8787        if nic_op == constants.DDM_REMOVE: 
8788          # remove the last nic 
8789          del instance.nics[-1] 
8790          result.append(("nic.%d" % len(instance.nics), "remove")) 
8791        elif nic_op == constants.DDM_ADD: 
8792          # mac and bridge should be set, by now 
8793          mac = nic_dict['mac'] 
8794          ip = nic_dict.get('ip', None) 
8795          nicparams = self.nic_pinst[constants.DDM_ADD] 
8796          new_nic = objects.NIC(mac=mac, ip=ip, nicparams=nicparams) 
8797          instance.nics.append(new_nic) 
8798          result.append(("nic.%d" % (len(instance.nics) - 1), 
8799                         "add:mac=%s,ip=%s,mode=%s,link=%s" % 
8800                         (new_nic.mac, new_nic.ip, 
8801                          self.nic_pnew[constants.DDM_ADD][constants.NIC_MODE], 
8802                          self.nic_pnew[constants.DDM_ADD][constants.NIC_LINK] 
8803                         ))) 
8804        else: 
8805          for key in 'mac', 'ip': 
8806            if key in nic_dict: 
8807              setattr(instance.nics[nic_op], key, nic_dict[key]) 
8808          if nic_op in self.nic_pinst: 
8809            instance.nics[nic_op].nicparams = self.nic_pinst[nic_op] 
8810          for key, val in nic_dict.iteritems(): 
8811            result.append(("nic.%s/%d" % (key, nic_op), val)) 
8812   
8813      # hvparams changes 
8814      if self.op.hvparams: 
8815        instance.hvparams = self.hv_inst 
8816        for key, val in self.op.hvparams.iteritems(): 
8817          result.append(("hv/%s" % key, val)) 
8818   
8819      # beparams changes 
8820      if self.op.beparams: 
8821        instance.beparams = self.be_inst 
8822        for key, val in self.op.beparams.iteritems(): 
8823          result.append(("be/%s" % key, val)) 
8824   
8825      # OS change 
8826      if self.op.os_name: 
8827        instance.os = self.op.os_name 
8828   
8829      self.cfg.Update(instance, feedback_fn) 
8830   
8831      return result 

8832   
8833    _DISK_CONVERSIONS = { 
8834      (constants.DT_PLAIN, constants.DT_DRBD8): _ConvertPlainToDrbd, 
8835      (constants.DT_DRBD8, constants.DT_PLAIN): _ConvertDrbdToPlain, 
8836      } 

8837

8849        self.needed_locks[locking.LEVEL_NODE] = locking.ALL_SET 
8850      else: 
8851        self.needed_locks[locking.LEVEL_NODE] = \ 
8852          _GetWantedNodes(self, self.op.nodes)

8860 -  def Exec(self, feedback_fn): 

8861      """Compute the list of all the exported system images. 
8862   
8863      @rtype: dict 
8864      @return: a dictionary with the structure node->(export-list) 
8865          where export-list is a list of the instances exported on 
8866          that node. 
8867   
8868      """ 
8869      rpcresult = self.rpc.call_export_list(self.nodes) 
8870      result = {} 
8871      for node in rpcresult: 
8872        if rpcresult[node].fail_msg: 
8873          result[node] = False 
8874        else: 
8875          result[node] = rpcresult[node].payload 
8876   
8877      return result

8953 -  def _CreateSnapshots(self, feedback_fn): 

8954      """Creates an LVM snapshot for every disk of the instance. 
8955   
8956      @return: List of snapshots as L{objects.Disk} instances 
8957   
8958      """ 
8959      instance = self.instance 
8960      src_node = instance.primary_node 
8961   
8962      vgname = self.cfg.GetVGName() 
8963   
8964      snap_disks = [] 
8965   
8966      for idx, disk in enumerate(instance.disks): 
8967        feedback_fn("Creating a snapshot of disk/%s on node %s" % 
8968                    (idx, src_node)) 
8969   
8970        # result.payload will be a snapshot of an lvm leaf of the one we 
8971        # passed 
8972        result = self.rpc.call_blockdev_snapshot(src_node, disk) 
8973        msg = result.fail_msg 
8974        if msg: 
8975          self.LogWarning("Could not snapshot disk/%s on node %s: %s", 
8976                          idx, src_node, msg) 
8977          snap_disks.append(False) 
8978        else: 
8979          disk_id = (vgname, result.payload) 
8980          new_dev = objects.Disk(dev_type=constants.LD_LV, size=disk.size, 
8981                                 logical_id=disk_id, physical_id=disk_id, 
8982                                 iv_name=disk.iv_name) 
8983          snap_disks.append(new_dev) 
8984   
8985      return snap_disks 

8986   

8987 -  def _RemoveSnapshot(self, feedback_fn, snap_disks, disk_index): 

8988      """Removes an LVM snapshot. 
8989   
8990      @type snap_disks: list 
8991      @param snap_disks: The list of all snapshots as returned by 
8992                         L{_CreateSnapshots} 
8993      @type disk_index: number 
8994      @param disk_index: Index of the snapshot to be removed 
8995      @rtype: bool 
8996      @return: Whether removal was successful or not 
8997   
8998      """ 
8999      disk = snap_disks[disk_index] 
9000      if disk: 
9001        src_node = self.instance.primary_node 
9002   
9003        feedback_fn("Removing snapshot of disk/%s on node %s" % 
9004                    (disk_index, src_node)) 
9005   
9006        result = self.rpc.call_blockdev_remove(src_node, disk) 
9007        if not result.fail_msg: 
9008          return True 
9009   
9010        self.LogWarning("Could not remove snapshot for disk/%d from node" 
9011                        " %s: %s", disk_index, src_node, result.fail_msg) 
9012   
9013      return False 

9014   

9015 -  def _CleanupExports(self, feedback_fn): 

9016      """Removes exports of current instance from all other nodes. 
9017   
9018      If an instance in a cluster with nodes A..D was exported to node C, its 
9019      exports will be removed from the nodes A, B and D. 
9020   
9021      """ 
9022      nodelist = self.cfg.GetNodeList() 
9023      nodelist.remove(self.dst_node.name) 
9024   
9025      # on one-node clusters nodelist will be empty after the removal 
9026      # if we proceed the backup would be removed because OpQueryExports 
9027      # substitutes an empty list with the full cluster node list. 
9028      iname = self.instance.name 
9029      if nodelist: 
9030        feedback_fn("Removing old exports for instance %s" % iname) 
9031        exportlist = self.rpc.call_export_list(nodelist) 
9032        for node in exportlist: 
9033          if exportlist[node].fail_msg: 
9034            continue 
9035          if iname in exportlist[node].payload: 
9036            msg = self.rpc.call_export_remove(node, iname).fail_msg 
9037            if msg: 
9038              self.LogWarning("Could not remove older export for instance %s" 
9039                              " on node %s: %s", iname, node, msg) 

9040   

9041 -  def Exec(self, feedback_fn): 

9042      """Export an instance to an image in the cluster. 
9043   
9044      """ 
9045      instance = self.instance 
9046      dst_node = self.dst_node 
9047      src_node = instance.primary_node 
9048   
9049      if self.op.shutdown: 
9050        # shutdown the instance, but not the disks 
9051        feedback_fn("Shutting down instance %s" % instance.name) 
9052        result = self.rpc.call_instance_shutdown(src_node, instance, 
9053                                                 self.shutdown_timeout) 
9054        result.Raise("Could not shutdown instance %s on" 
9055                     " node %s" % (instance.name, src_node)) 
9056   
9057      # set the disks ID correctly since call_instance_start needs the 
9058      # correct drbd minor to create the symlinks 
9059      for disk in instance.disks: 
9060        self.cfg.SetDiskID(disk, src_node) 
9061   
9062      activate_disks = (not instance.admin_up) 
9063   
9064      if activate_disks: 
9065        # Activate the instance disks if we'exporting a stopped instance 
9066        feedback_fn("Activating disks for %s" % instance.name) 
9067        _StartInstanceDisks(self, instance, None) 
9068   
9069      try: 
9070        # per-disk results 
9071        dresults = [] 
9072        removed_snaps = [False] * len(instance.disks) 
9073   
9074        snap_disks = None 
9075        try: 
9076          try: 
9077            snap_disks = self._CreateSnapshots(feedback_fn) 
9078          finally: 
9079            if self.op.shutdown and instance.admin_up: 
9080              feedback_fn("Starting instance %s" % instance.name) 
9081              result = self.rpc.call_instance_start(src_node, instance, 
9082                                                    None, None) 
9083              msg = result.fail_msg 
9084              if msg: 
9085                _ShutdownInstanceDisks(self, instance) 
9086                raise errors.OpExecError("Could not start instance: %s" % msg) 
9087   
9088          assert len(snap_disks) == len(instance.disks) 
9089          assert len(removed_snaps) == len(instance.disks) 
9090   
9091          # TODO: check for size 
9092   
9093          cluster_name = self.cfg.GetClusterName() 
9094          for idx, dev in enumerate(snap_disks): 
9095            feedback_fn("Exporting snapshot %s from %s to %s" % 
9096                        (idx, src_node, dst_node.name)) 
9097            if dev: 
9098              # FIXME: pass debug from opcode to backend 
9099              result = self.rpc.call_snapshot_export(src_node, dev, dst_node.name, 
9100                                                     instance, cluster_name, 
9101                                                     idx, self.op.debug_level) 
9102              msg = result.fail_msg 
9103              if msg: 
9104                self.LogWarning("Could not export disk/%s from node %s to" 
9105                                " node %s: %s", idx, src_node, dst_node.name, msg) 
9106                dresults.append(False) 
9107              else: 
9108                dresults.append(True) 
9109   
9110              # Remove snapshot 
9111              if self._RemoveSnapshot(feedback_fn, snap_disks, idx): 
9112                removed_snaps[idx] = True 
9113            else: 
9114              dresults.append(False) 
9115   
9116          assert len(dresults) == len(instance.disks) 
9117   
9118          # Check for backwards compatibility 
9119          assert compat.all(isinstance(i, bool) for i in dresults), \ 
9120                 "Not all results are boolean: %r" % dresults 
9121   
9122          feedback_fn("Finalizing export on %s" % dst_node.name) 
9123          result = self.rpc.call_finalize_export(dst_node.name, instance, 
9124                                                 snap_disks) 
9125          msg = result.fail_msg 
9126          fin_resu = not msg 
9127          if msg: 
9128            self.LogWarning("Could not finalize export for instance %s" 
9129                            " on node %s: %s", instance.name, dst_node.name, msg) 
9130   
9131        finally: 
9132          # Remove all snapshots 
9133          assert len(removed_snaps) == len(instance.disks) 
9134          for idx, removed in enumerate(removed_snaps): 
9135            if not removed: 
9136              self._RemoveSnapshot(feedback_fn, snap_disks, idx) 
9137   
9138      finally: 
9139        if activate_disks: 
9140          feedback_fn("Deactivating disks for %s" % instance.name) 
9141          _ShutdownInstanceDisks(self, instance) 
9142   
9143      self._CleanupExports(feedback_fn) 
9144   
9145      return fin_resu, dresults

9148 -class LURemoveExport(NoHooksLU):

9155 -  def ExpandNames(self): 

9156      self.needed_locks = {} 
9157      # We need all nodes to be locked in order for RemoveExport to work, but we 
9158      # don't need to lock the instance itself, as nothing will happen to it (and 
9159      # we can remove exports also for a removed instance) 
9160      self.needed_locks[locking.LEVEL_NODE] = locking.ALL_SET

9162 -  def CheckPrereq(self): 

9163      """Check prerequisites.

9165      pass

9167 -  def Exec(self, feedback_fn): 

9168      """Remove any export. 
9169   
9170      """ 
9171      instance_name = self.cfg.ExpandInstanceName(self.op.instance_name) 
9172      # If the instance was not found we'll try with the name that was passed in. 
9173      # This will only work if it was an FQDN, though. 
9174      fqdn_warn = False 
9175      if not instance_name: 
9176        fqdn_warn = True 
9177        instance_name = self.op.instance_name 
9178   
9179      locked_nodes = self.acquired_locks[locking.LEVEL_NODE] 
9180      exportlist = self.rpc.call_export_list(locked_nodes) 
9181      found = False 
9182      for node in exportlist: 
9183        msg = exportlist[node].fail_msg 
9184        if msg: 
9185          self.LogWarning("Failed to query node %s (continuing): %s", node, msg) 
9186          continue 
9187        if instance_name in exportlist[node].payload: 
9188          found = True 
9189          result = self.rpc.call_export_remove(node, instance_name) 
9190          msg = result.fail_msg 
9191          if msg: 
9192            logging.error("Could not remove export for instance %s" 
9193                          " on node %s: %s", instance_name, node, msg) 
9194   
9195      if fqdn_warn and not found: 
9196        feedback_fn("Export not found. If trying to remove an export belonging" 
9197                    " to a deleted instance please use its Fully Qualified" 
9198                    " Domain Name.")

9268 -  def Exec(self, feedback_fn): 

9269      """Returns the tag list. 
9270   
9271      """ 
9272      cfg = self.cfg 
9273      tgts = [("/cluster", cfg.GetClusterInfo())] 
9274      ilist = cfg.GetAllInstancesInfo().values() 
9275      tgts.extend([("/instances/%s" % i.name, i) for i in ilist]) 
9276      nlist = cfg.GetAllNodesInfo().values()

9280        for tag in target.GetTags(): 
9281          if self.re.search(tag): 
9282            results.append((path, tag)) 
9283      return results

9322 -  def CheckPrereq(self): 

9323      """Check prerequisites. 
9324   
9325      This checks that we have the given tag. 
9326   
9327      """ 
9328      TagsLU.CheckPrereq(self) 
9329      for tag in self.op.tags: 
9330        objects.TaggableObject.ValidateTag(tag) 
9331      del_tags = frozenset(self.op.tags) 
9332      cur_tags = self.target.GetTags()

9336        diff_names.sort()

9349 -class LUTestDelay(NoHooksLU): 

9350    """Sleep for a specified amount of time. 
9351   
9352    This LU sleeps on the master and/or nodes for a specified amount of 
9353    time. 
9354   
9355    """ 
9356    _OP_REQP = ["duration", "on_master", "on_nodes"] 
9357    REQ_BGL = False 
9358   

9359 -  def ExpandNames(self): 

9360      """Expand names and set required locks. 
9361   
9362      This expands the node list, if any. 
9363   
9364      """ 
9365      self.needed_locks = {} 
9366      if self.op.on_nodes: 
9367        # _GetWantedNodes can be used here, but is not always appropriate to use 
9368        # this way in ExpandNames. Check LogicalUnit.ExpandNames docstring for 
9369        # more information. 
9370        self.op.on_nodes = _GetWantedNodes(self, self.op.on_nodes) 
9371        self.needed_locks[locking.LEVEL_NODE] = self.op.on_nodes 

9372   

9373 -  def CheckPrereq(self):

9375   
9376      """ 

9377   

9378 -  def Exec(self, feedback_fn): 

9379      """Do the actual sleep. 
9380   
9381      """ 
9382      if self.op.on_master: 
9383        if not utils.TestDelay(self.op.duration): 
9384          raise errors.OpExecError("Error during master delay test") 
9385      if self.op.on_nodes: 
9386        result = self.rpc.call_test_delay(self.op.on_nodes, self.op.duration) 
9387        for node, node_result in result.items(): 
9388          node_result.Raise("Failure during rpc call to node %s" % node) 

9389   

9390   
9391 -class IAllocator(object): 

9392    """IAllocator framework. 
9393   
9394    An IAllocator instance has three sets of attributes: 
9395      - cfg that is needed to query the cluster 
9396      - input data (all members of the _KEYS class attribute are required) 
9397      - four buffer attributes (in|out_data|text), that represent the 
9398        input (to the external script) in text and data structure format, 
9399        and the output from it, again in two formats 
9400      - the result variables from the script (success, info, nodes) for 
9401        easy usage 
9402   
9403    """ 
9404    # pylint: disable-msg=R0902 
9405    # lots of instance attributes 
9406    _ALLO_KEYS = [ 
9407      "name", "mem_size", "disks", "disk_template", 
9408      "os", "tags", "nics", "vcpus", "hypervisor", 
9409      ] 
9410    _RELO_KEYS = [ 
9411      "name", "relocate_from", 
9412      ] 
9413    _EVAC_KEYS = [ 
9414      "evac_nodes", 
9415      ] 
9416   

9417 -  def __init__(self, cfg, rpc, mode, **kwargs): 

9418      self.cfg = cfg 
9419      self.rpc = rpc 
9420      # init buffer variables 
9421      self.in_text = self.out_text = self.in_data = self.out_data = None 
9422      # init all input fields so that pylint is happy 
9423      self.mode = mode 
9424      self.mem_size = self.disks = self.disk_template = None 
9425      self.os = self.tags = self.nics = self.vcpus = None 
9426      self.hypervisor = None 
9427      self.relocate_from = None 
9428      self.name = None 
9429      self.evac_nodes = None 
9430      # computed fields 
9431      self.required_nodes = None 
9432      # init result fields 
9433      self.success = self.info = self.result = None 
9434      if self.mode == constants.IALLOCATOR_MODE_ALLOC: 
9435        keyset = self._ALLO_KEYS 
9436        fn = self._AddNewInstance 
9437      elif self.mode == constants.IALLOCATOR_MODE_RELOC: 
9438        keyset = self._RELO_KEYS 
9439        fn = self._AddRelocateInstance 
9440      elif self.mode == constants.IALLOCATOR_MODE_MEVAC: 
9441        keyset = self._EVAC_KEYS 
9442        fn = self._AddEvacuateNodes 
9443      else: 
9444        raise errors.ProgrammerError("Unknown mode '%s' passed to the" 
9445                                     " IAllocator" % self.mode) 
9446      for key in kwargs: 
9447        if key not in keyset: 
9448          raise errors.ProgrammerError("Invalid input parameter '%s' to" 
9449                                       " IAllocator" % key) 
9450        setattr(self, key, kwargs[key]) 
9451   
9452      for key in keyset: 
9453        if key not in kwargs: 
9454          raise errors.ProgrammerError("Missing input parameter '%s' to" 
9455                                       " IAllocator" % key) 
9456      self._BuildInputData(fn) 

9457   

9458 -  def _ComputeClusterData(self): 

9459      """Compute the generic allocator input data. 
9460   
9461      This is the data that is independent of the actual operation. 
9462   
9463      """ 
9464      cfg = self.cfg 
9465      cluster_info = cfg.GetClusterInfo() 
9466      # cluster data 
9467      data = { 
9468        "version": constants.IALLOCATOR_VERSION, 
9469        "cluster_name": cfg.GetClusterName(), 
9470        "cluster_tags": list(cluster_info.GetTags()), 
9471        "enabled_hypervisors": list(cluster_info.enabled_hypervisors), 
9472        # we don't have job IDs 
9473        } 
9474      iinfo = cfg.GetAllInstancesInfo().values() 
9475      i_list = [(inst, cluster_info.FillBE(inst)) for inst in iinfo] 
9476   
9477      # node data 
9478      node_results = {} 
9479      node_list = cfg.GetNodeList() 
9480   
9481      if self.mode == constants.IALLOCATOR_MODE_ALLOC: 
9482        hypervisor_name = self.hypervisor 
9483      elif self.mode == constants.IALLOCATOR_MODE_RELOC: 
9484        hypervisor_name = cfg.GetInstanceInfo(self.name).hypervisor 
9485      elif self.mode == constants.IALLOCATOR_MODE_MEVAC: 
9486        hypervisor_name = cluster_info.enabled_hypervisors[0] 
9487   
9488      node_data = self.rpc.call_node_info(node_list, cfg.GetVGName(), 
9489                                          hypervisor_name) 
9490      node_iinfo = \ 
9491        self.rpc.call_all_instances_info(node_list, 
9492                                         cluster_info.enabled_hypervisors) 
9493      for nname, nresult in node_data.items(): 
9494        # first fill in static (config-based) values 
9495        ninfo = cfg.GetNodeInfo(nname) 
9496        pnr = { 
9497          "tags": list(ninfo.GetTags()), 
9498          "primary_ip": ninfo.primary_ip, 
9499          "secondary_ip": ninfo.secondary_ip, 
9500          "offline": ninfo.offline, 
9501          "drained": ninfo.drained, 
9502          "master_candidate": ninfo.master_candidate, 
9503          } 
9504   
9505        if not (ninfo.offline or ninfo.drained): 
9506          nresult.Raise("Can't get data for node %s" % nname) 
9507          node_iinfo[nname].Raise("Can't get node instance info from node %s" % 
9508                                  nname) 
9509          remote_info = nresult.payload 
9510   
9511          for attr in ['memory_total', 'memory_free', 'memory_dom0', 
9512                       'vg_size', 'vg_free', 'cpu_total']: 
9513            if attr not in remote_info: 
9514              raise errors.OpExecError("Node '%s' didn't return attribute" 
9515                                       " '%s'" % (nname, attr)) 
9516            if not isinstance(remote_info[attr], int): 
9517              raise errors.OpExecError("Node '%s' returned invalid value" 
9518                                       " for '%s': %s" % 
9519                                       (nname, attr, remote_info[attr])) 
9520          # compute memory used by primary instances 
9521          i_p_mem = i_p_up_mem = 0 
9522          for iinfo, beinfo in i_list: 
9523            if iinfo.primary_node == nname: 
9524              i_p_mem += beinfo[constants.BE_MEMORY] 
9525              if iinfo.name not in node_iinfo[nname].payload: 
9526                i_used_mem = 0 
9527              else: 
9528                i_used_mem = int(node_iinfo[nname].payload[iinfo.name]['memory']) 
9529              i_mem_diff = beinfo[constants.BE_MEMORY] - i_used_mem 
9530              remote_info['memory_free'] -= max(0, i_mem_diff) 
9531   
9532              if iinfo.admin_up: 
9533                i_p_up_mem += beinfo[constants.BE_MEMORY] 
9534   
9535          # compute memory used by instances 
9536          pnr_dyn = { 
9537            "total_memory": remote_info['memory_total'], 
9538            "reserved_memory": remote_info['memory_dom0'], 
9539            "free_memory": remote_info['memory_free'], 
9540            "total_disk": remote_info['vg_size'], 
9541            "free_disk": remote_info['vg_free'], 
9542            "total_cpus": remote_info['cpu_total'], 
9543            "i_pri_memory": i_p_mem, 
9544            "i_pri_up_memory": i_p_up_mem, 
9545            } 
9546          pnr.update(pnr_dyn) 
9547   
9548        node_results[nname] = pnr 
9549      data["nodes"] = node_results 
9550   
9551      # instance data 
9552      instance_data = {} 
9553      for iinfo, beinfo in i_list: 
9554        nic_data = [] 
9555        for nic in iinfo.nics: 
9556          filled_params = objects.FillDict( 
9557              cluster_info.nicparams[constants.PP_DEFAULT], 
9558              nic.nicparams) 
9559          nic_dict = {"mac": nic.mac, 
9560                      "ip": nic.ip, 
9561                      "mode": filled_params[constants.NIC_MODE], 
9562                      "link": filled_params[constants.NIC_LINK], 
9563                     } 
9564          if filled_params[constants.NIC_MODE] == constants.NIC_MODE_BRIDGED: 
9565            nic_dict["bridge"] = filled_params[constants.NIC_LINK] 
9566          nic_data.append(nic_dict) 
9567        pir = { 
9568          "tags": list(iinfo.GetTags()), 
9569          "admin_up": iinfo.admin_up, 
9570          "vcpus": beinfo[constants.BE_VCPUS], 
9571          "memory": beinfo[constants.BE_MEMORY], 
9572          "os": iinfo.os, 
9573          "nodes": [iinfo.primary_node] + list(iinfo.secondary_nodes), 
9574          "nics": nic_data, 
9575          "disks": [{"size": dsk.size, "mode": dsk.mode} for dsk in iinfo.disks], 
9576          "disk_template": iinfo.disk_template, 
9577          "hypervisor": iinfo.hypervisor, 
9578          } 
9579        pir["disk_space_total"] = _ComputeDiskSize(iinfo.disk_template, 
9580                                                   pir["disks"]) 
9581        instance_data[iinfo.name] = pir 
9582   
9583      data["instances"] = instance_data 
9584   
9585      self.in_data = data 

9586   

9587 -  def _AddNewInstance(self): 

9588      """Add new instance data to allocator structure. 
9589   
9590      This in combination with _AllocatorGetClusterData will create the 
9591      correct structure needed as input for the allocator. 
9592   
9593      The checks for the completeness of the opcode must have already been 
9594      done. 
9595   
9596      """ 
9597      disk_space = _ComputeDiskSize(self.disk_template, self.disks) 
9598   
9599      if self.disk_template in constants.DTS_NET_MIRROR: 
9600        self.required_nodes = 2 
9601      else: 
9602        self.required_nodes = 1 
9603      request = { 
9604        "name": self.name, 
9605        "disk_template": self.disk_template, 
9606        "tags": self.tags, 
9607        "os": self.os, 
9608        "vcpus": self.vcpus, 
9609        "memory": self.mem_size, 
9610        "disks": self.disks, 
9611        "disk_space_total": disk_space, 
9612        "nics": self.nics, 
9613        "required_nodes": self.required_nodes, 
9614        } 
9615      return request 

9616   

9617 -  def _AddRelocateInstance(self): 

9618      """Add relocate instance data to allocator structure. 
9619   
9620      This in combination with _IAllocatorGetClusterData will create the 
9621      correct structure needed as input for the allocator. 
9622   
9623      The checks for the completeness of the opcode must have already been 
9624      done. 
9625   
9626      """ 
9627      instance = self.cfg.GetInstanceInfo(self.name) 
9628      if instance is None: 
9629        raise errors.ProgrammerError("Unknown instance '%s' passed to" 
9630                                     " IAllocator" % self.name) 
9631   
9632      if instance.disk_template not in constants.DTS_NET_MIRROR: 
9633        raise errors.OpPrereqError("Can't relocate non-mirrored instances", 
9634                                   errors.ECODE_INVAL) 
9635   
9636      if len(instance.secondary_nodes) != 1: 
9637        raise errors.OpPrereqError("Instance has not exactly one secondary node", 
9638                                   errors.ECODE_STATE) 
9639   
9640      self.required_nodes = 1 
9641      disk_sizes = [{'size': disk.size} for disk in instance.disks] 
9642      disk_space = _ComputeDiskSize(instance.disk_template, disk_sizes) 
9643   
9644      request = { 
9645        "name": self.name, 
9646        "disk_space_total": disk_space, 
9647        "required_nodes": self.required_nodes, 
9648        "relocate_from": self.relocate_from, 
9649        } 
9650      return request 

9651   

9652 -  def _AddEvacuateNodes(self): 

9653      """Add evacuate nodes data to allocator structure. 
9654   
9655      """ 
9656      request = { 
9657        "evac_nodes": self.evac_nodes 
9658        } 
9659      return request 

9660   

9661 -  def _BuildInputData(self, fn): 

9662      """Build input data structures. 
9663   
9664      """ 
9665      self._ComputeClusterData() 
9666   
9667      request = fn() 
9668      request["type"] = self.mode 
9669      self.in_data["request"] = request 
9670   
9671      self.in_text = serializer.Dump(self.in_data) 

9672   

9673 -  def Run(self, name, validate=True, call_fn=None): 

9674      """Run an instance allocator and return the results. 
9675   
9676      """ 
9677      if call_fn is None: 
9678        call_fn = self.rpc.call_iallocator_runner 
9679   
9680      result = call_fn(self.cfg.GetMasterNode(), name, self.in_text) 
9681      result.Raise("Failure while running the iallocator script") 
9682   
9683      self.out_text = result.payload 
9684      if validate: 
9685        self._ValidateResult() 

9686   

9687 -  def _ValidateResult(self): 

9688      """Process the allocator results. 
9689   
9690      This will process and if successful save the result in 
9691      self.out_data and the other parameters. 
9692   
9693      """ 
9694      try: 
9695        rdict = serializer.Load(self.out_text) 
9696      except Exception, err: 
9697        raise errors.OpExecError("Can't parse iallocator results: %s" % str(err)) 
9698   
9699      if not isinstance(rdict, dict): 
9700        raise errors.OpExecError("Can't parse iallocator results: not a dict") 
9701   
9702      # TODO: remove backwards compatiblity in later versions 
9703      if "nodes" in rdict and "result" not in rdict: 
9704        rdict["result"] = rdict["nodes"] 
9705        del rdict["nodes"] 
9706   
9707      for key in "success", "info", "result": 
9708        if key not in rdict: 
9709          raise errors.OpExecError("Can't parse iallocator results:" 
9710                                   " missing key '%s'" % key) 
9711        setattr(self, key, rdict[key]) 
9712   
9713      if not isinstance(rdict["result"], list): 
9714        raise errors.OpExecError("Can't parse iallocator results: 'result' key" 
9715                                 " is not a list") 
9716      self.out_data = rdict

9719 -class LUTestAllocator(NoHooksLU): 

9720    """Run allocator tests. 
9721   
9722    This LU runs the allocator tests 
9723   
9724    """ 
9725    _OP_REQP = ["direction", "mode", "name"] 
9726   

9727 -  def CheckPrereq(self): 

9728      """Check prerequisites. 
9729   
9730      This checks the opcode parameters depending on the director and mode test. 
9731   
9732      """ 
9733      if self.op.mode == constants.IALLOCATOR_MODE_ALLOC: 
9734        for attr in ["name", "mem_size", "disks", "disk_template", 
9735                     "os", "tags", "nics", "vcpus"]: 
9736          if not hasattr(self.op, attr): 
9737            raise errors.OpPrereqError("Missing attribute '%s' on opcode input" % 
9738                                       attr, errors.ECODE_INVAL) 
9739        iname = self.cfg.ExpandInstanceName(self.op.name) 
9740        if iname is not None: 
9741          raise errors.OpPrereqError("Instance '%s' already in the cluster" % 
9742                                     iname, errors.ECODE_EXISTS) 
9743        if not isinstance(self.op.nics, list): 
9744          raise errors.OpPrereqError("Invalid parameter 'nics'", 
9745                                     errors.ECODE_INVAL) 
9746        for row in self.op.nics: 
9747          if (not isinstance(row, dict) or 
9748              "mac" not in row or 
9749              "ip" not in row or 
9750              "bridge" not in row): 
9751            raise errors.OpPrereqError("Invalid contents of the 'nics'" 
9752                                       " parameter", errors.ECODE_INVAL) 
9753        if not isinstance(self.op.disks, list): 
9754          raise errors.OpPrereqError("Invalid parameter 'disks'", 
9755                                     errors.ECODE_INVAL) 
9756        for row in self.op.disks: 
9757          if (not isinstance(row, dict) or 
9758              "size" not in row or 
9759              not isinstance(row["size"], int) or 
9760              "mode" not in row or 
9761              row["mode"] not in ['r', 'w']): 
9762            raise errors.OpPrereqError("Invalid contents of the 'disks'" 
9763                                       " parameter", errors.ECODE_INVAL) 
9764        if not hasattr(self.op, "hypervisor") or self.op.hypervisor is None: 
9765          self.op.hypervisor = self.cfg.GetHypervisorType() 
9766      elif self.op.mode == constants.IALLOCATOR_MODE_RELOC: 
9767        if not hasattr(self.op, "name"): 
9768          raise errors.OpPrereqError("Missing attribute 'name' on opcode input", 
9769                                     errors.ECODE_INVAL) 
9770        fname = _ExpandInstanceName(self.cfg, self.op.name) 
9771        self.op.name = fname 
9772        self.relocate_from = self.cfg.GetInstanceInfo(fname).secondary_nodes 
9773      elif self.op.mode == constants.IALLOCATOR_MODE_MEVAC: 
9774        if not hasattr(self.op, "evac_nodes"): 
9775          raise errors.OpPrereqError("Missing attribute 'evac_nodes' on" 
9776                                     " opcode input", errors.ECODE_INVAL) 
9777      else: 
9778        raise errors.OpPrereqError("Invalid test allocator mode '%s'" % 
9779                                   self.op.mode, errors.ECODE_INVAL) 
9780   
9781      if self.op.direction == constants.IALLOCATOR_DIR_OUT: 
9782        if not hasattr(self.op, "allocator") or self.op.allocator is None: 
9783          raise errors.OpPrereqError("Missing allocator name", 
9784                                     errors.ECODE_INVAL) 
9785      elif self.op.direction != constants.IALLOCATOR_DIR_IN: 
9786        raise errors.OpPrereqError("Wrong allocator test '%s'" % 
9787                                   self.op.direction, errors.ECODE_INVAL) 

9788   

9789 -  def Exec(self, feedback_fn): 

9790      """Run the allocator test. 
9791   
9792      """ 
9793      if self.op.mode == constants.IALLOCATOR_MODE_ALLOC: 
9794        ial = IAllocator(self.cfg, self.rpc, 
9795                         mode=self.op.mode, 
9796                         name=self.op.name, 
9797                         mem_size=self.op.mem_size, 
9798                         disks=self.op.disks, 
9799                         disk_template=self.op.disk_template, 
9800                         os=self.op.os, 
9801                         tags=self.op.tags, 
9802                         nics=self.op.nics, 
9803                         vcpus=self.op.vcpus, 
9804                         hypervisor=self.op.hypervisor, 
9805                         ) 
9806      elif self.op.mode == constants.IALLOCATOR_MODE_RELOC: 
9807        ial = IAllocator(self.cfg, self.rpc, 
9808                         mode=self.op.mode, 
9809                         name=self.op.name, 
9810                         relocate_from=list(self.relocate_from), 
9811                         ) 
9812      elif self.op.mode == constants.IALLOCATOR_MODE_MEVAC: 
9813        ial = IAllocator(self.cfg, self.rpc, 
9814                         mode=self.op.mode, 
9815                         evac_nodes=self.op.evac_nodes) 
9816      else: 
9817        raise errors.ProgrammerError("Uncatched mode %s in" 
9818                                     " LUTestAllocator.Exec", self.op.mode) 
9819   
9820      if self.op.direction == constants.IALLOCATOR_DIR_IN: 
9821        result = ial.in_text 
9822      else: 
9823        ial.Run(self.op.allocator, validate=False) 
9824        result = ial.out_text 
9825      return result
